Dr. Clymer is very helpful in office hours or anytime and is very understanding of his students.  The homework can be long but is very helpful for exams

Clymer is one of the best. Unlike most of the ECE faculties, he is there to teach you, help you, and answer your questions. Responds to emails very quickly, and gives very clear lectures. He doesn't bombard you with 1000s of theories and equations. Instead, he teaches you what you really need in real world. Very fair instructor.

Clymer is extremely fair and helpful. He encourages questions and is always happy to see students come to office hours. He records his lectures and uploads them to Carmen so you can review the material again later. You want Clymer as a professor.

Great prof. He's the kind of prof, whose material will stick in your head for a long time. Brilliantly planned questions that provokes thought. The best part is his assignments are real world problems. And always ready to give hints. If you are new to the subject you really have to earn the grade, so don't expect to get much sleep.
Very kind person and willing to help.

The best professor ever. Almost everything is available online. You can watch the lecture online because he taped it. The notes are online too. Exams are pretty easy although the homeworks are a little tedious. He cares a lot about his students, he is a man with a big heart

The rare professor who thinks it's more important to give students confidence to tackle difficult problems, rather than breaking them down.  Amazing how this approach motivates you to do assignments and practice for exams, rather than dread the work and just toil to get it over with.  The good cop to the bad cops of the department.

like all the previous feedbacks i would say he is one of the best ece profs. do not miss a class with prof clymer. you will learn alot if you are willing to ask questions and he would explain you stuff time and over again till you dont understand it.he is a ridiculously nice man at heart.
One of the best teachers in the ECE department.  Hated the subject of the class but ended up enjoying the class anyway.  Exams are pretty easy and he explains the material very well.

He isn't the kind of prof to treat students with disdain. If you don't understand the fundamentals, he'll explain them to you, not brush you off. His homework is challenging but he'll give you hints, and group work makes them pretty fair. Great prof overall.
He is very helpful and 'cares' about the students quite a bit.  The exams are fair, and he keeps lecture somewhat interesting.  You gotta respect his bow-tie too.
This guy is great. He puts movies of all the lectures on the internet, so you never have to come to class. His exams are very reasonable, and he really seems like he cares about you.
Great prof & class.  Learn a lot, espcailly applications.  Class consists of all projects and no tests, and is worthwhile.  Very knowledge about about the subject.
He is the best teacher I have ever had.  I was not interested in the material at all, but his examples were very intriguing.  I learned more in this class than any other engineering class.
So cute!

Clymer is one of the best, if not the best in the department.  He's fun, appropriately difficult and challenging and you learn a lot.  He's one of those profs where you can tell he's been in industry in the past.  You learn theory and how it's really used
Nicest guy in Department
Love the bow-tie

Love Dr. H. Super friendly guy who clearly cares about students and their progress. Great course and lectures as well. Ohio State FEH classes are brutal but the instruction is top notch and Dr. H. is no exception. Be prepared to do a *lot* of hands-on assignments ("apps") which are not easy (better than FEH 1 though) and group work during class.

Dr. H was a great prof. Class had a lot of work, especially with the lab reports, so start early. He was a very caring and nice instructor, and had great knowledge of MATLAB and C. Overall, great prof.

I loved Dr. H, he genuinely cared about his students and all of the office hours available outside of class were extremely helpful. As a student who had never coded before, he made everything a very seamless progression, and everything was easy to understand and follow with the practice problems and homework. Highly recommend!
Probably one of the best professors I've had! Though it was his first time teaching, he knew the material well and kept the class engaged.

Professor El Hamahmy is amazing! Nne of my favorite professors, and genuinely cares about his students. Lectures are chill, you MATLAB, C/C++ as well as engineering fundamentals. There is a coding project instead of final. Weekly assignments, from lectures and from labs, lecture assignments are doable, but lab assignments take up the most time.

Dr. Hamahmy, better known as Dr. H has by far been the best professor I've had in college so far. He makes an effort to get to know every single one of his students of they let him. Another great thing is that he's always accessible for you to ask questions so his assignments aren't impossible if you make the effort to ask questions.

Maybe the best teacher I have ever had. A great personality along with a good understanding of MATLAB and how to teach it. The course uses a fair amount of things learned in ENG1181. It is very important that you work though homework and practice problems, because if you fall behind, you fall fast. Stay in contact with / see him outside of class.

The lab segment of this class was brutal, but the lectures (the part Dr. Kramer was responsible for) were great. She gets everyone involved, gives great feedback, and both her and her TAs are highly available in and out of class and happy to help students. I actually enjoyed the software design project at the end of the class. Highly recommend.

Dr Kramer is great. Incredibly caring and very knowledgeable. Class itself is hard and that will be consistent for all sections, but Dr Kramer knows the course very well which was incredibly helpful. If you get the chance, I would highly recommend! Couldn't get a nicer, more genuine professor at OSU
She's so kind and really helpful to her students.

Professor Kramer is great. Class itself is pretty easy, although the lab component can be brutal sometimes. Good lecturer, genuinely cares about the students and is willing to help, and lots of hands-on projects and "application" assignments. No textbook required (but if taking Honors, a MATLAB textbook is recommended for the programming sections).
Really nice professor, understandable, and flexible with deadlines if you ask. Also can really be helpful for additional projects if needed.

Amazing professor, deeply motivated and wanted students to make sure they understood the content. He made lecture's extremely easy to understand the material and very helpful in office hours if you needed more help. Quizzes were extremely specific regarding content but manageable. Take his class if you can.

Chris is legit the best. It was an honor to have him as my lecturer, and he is the main reason I am pursuing a humanitarian engineering minor. I would give almost anything to have him as a prof again!!

Dr. Ratcliff is awesome. He truly cares about his students and although 1181 is just a ton of busywork he makes the work a lot more bearable. He is always willing to help on projects and makes an effort to take an interest in his students. Truly a goat professor!
Professor Ratcliff was an amazing professor and cared about his students. Directions and outlines are clear for grading.
Dr. Ratcliff is a great engineering professor. His 1182 class is much more fun and interesting than 1181. He is very helpful and a good professor to make connections with.

Dr. Ratcliff shows applications of engineering and make sure we understand not only the technical part of engineering, but also the ethical side of it. I haven't had anyone explain engineering to me in that way and I will apply his ideas in my career. He understand circumstances with deadlines and is my most approchable professor.

Dr.Ratcliff is a really good instructor for the FE courses. He cares about his students deeply, yet will get you prepared so you can do well on the assignments and tests. TA's do usually matter a bunch in making this course tolerable but Dr.Ratcliff is very good at making sure the TA's are doing their job. Very likeable guy too. Take him if u can!

If you have to take 1181, do it with Dr. Ratcliff. Absolutely amazing professor, despite some things he's unable to change about the course itself. He's a great guy and he understands that this is too much for 2 credit hours,  so he's very understanding in how he gives extensions. Talk to him after class if you can, he's a great conversationalist.

Dr. Ratcliff was definitely one of my favorite professors I've had at OSU. He always had personal stories that related to the material he was teaching us and he genuinely cared about helping every group excel with their engineering design process. I think the the class 1182 could be changed some to be less paper heavy but I enjoyed having him.

Great teacher. I had no coding experience and he taught it well. Make sure to participate in the class. He gave many extensions, and a lot of good advice. Honestly, he made me realize engineering was the right choice for me. Hands down amazing teacher and human being.

Very nice, respectful, and accommodating guy. Some of the assignments are rather difficult but with a group they're manageable (as long as your group is competent). I had a particularly nice group (though it was only 3 people) and we managed to do pretty well. Easily one of my favorite professors at OSU.

Dr. Ratclidd was a great professor and cares about his students. Beware this class is a weed-out. It's a lot of work and frustrating depending on the group you get. It is doable if you are willing to do the work your group slacks on. Definitely do not save work till the last minute or you won't do well. The class taught great engr skills though.

The class is tough and there is a lot of work, because it is a weed out course. There is a lot of group assignments and class applications that take a long time. But Professor Ratcliff is a great professor and is very understanding of delays and issues that occur. He is great at teaching the material and I would highly recommend taking his course.
He was great, the class went smoothly.

The best teacher Ive ever had. Hes such a great guy and he really cares about his students and their success. Although the content of his class is somewhat boring, he does all he can to make it interesting. His experiences outside the classroom involving engineering are invigorating and youll get to learn all about it.

Dr. Ratcliff was a great professor overall. Sometimes the lectures could drag, but that has to do with the content more than the professor himself. He is very easy to approach and ask questions, and continues to be a great resource. There was quite a bit of out of class work, but nothing unmanageable. He gives lots of time to do the work in class.

Prof. Ratcliff is a great professor stuck with a dull course. However, he really tries to engage with the class and encourages us to pursue engineering. I really enjoyed hearing about his experiences in the field. Also, he's always down to help you if you need it or explain things better.

Out of all your options hes the only one that can teach the class well. Hes super flexible about assignments, stressors, and just your life in general. That said this class is still busy work but he makes it doable. All you have to do is hope you have a good group and good TAs and you should be good for this class. Definitely would take him again

This class is difficult by inheritance, from the department, but you gotta take him as a professor. Literally the only guy that can actually teach this class and actually care for the students. Very flexible with assignments and understanding of everyone's circumstances. Clarifies any holes he finds with assignment instructions.
Super flexible and understanding professor. Very clear about what he expects of us in projects and assignments and all his lessons are easy to understand. All my classmates love him.
Chris is a fantastic professor. Fundamentals of Engineering is a difficult class and Chris knows that and does a great job preparing the class.
Mr. Ratcliff is understanding and caring, highly recommended to take his class. Hes not too harsh on grading too.

He is super nice and cares about students' learning process. He always provides a bunch of examples to make students fully understand each concepts during class. It is extremely valuable to take his class.

The class is annoying and requires a lot of effort. The class is department run and he apologizes for how much homework is given by the department. He extends due dates for assignments and is accessible outside of class
He is awesome. He cares a lot about you and does everything he can to make sure you do well. He understands you have a life and he is very passionate. As for 1181 just hope you have a good group.

Prof. Ratclif is a really nice dude. He shows up to class ready to teach and never forgets to address any questions people have. He talks about his interests a lot (farming and solar panels). Really great professor.
He is just so nice. The grade is always satisfying though labs are kind of stressful. And there are some easy extra credits. Definitely should take his class.
Lecture is great with Dr. Ratcliff. Attendance is not mandatory for lecture but you will miss a lot if you don't go. Attendance for lab is mandatory, but lecture is more important than lab.

Overall, awesome teacher/mentor. He knows so much about everything (from farming to engineering) and is very passionate in all that he does. He is very empathetic towards students and considers your workload/stress level. 100/10 would recommend.
Super understanding guy Really tries to make the course as not stressful as possible

Engineering 1151 is a very annoying class with an insane amount of work for a 2 hour course, but Ratcliff is a fantastic professor. He routinely apologized for how much work was assigned (he doesn't have a say in it). He extends deadlines, gives extra credit, grades assignments quick, helps students, and is just a very nice guy in general.

1181 is a lot of work, but Ratcliff is definitely a good choice and a good guy. He often extended deadlines, posted review videos, and was very knowledgeable. He is very helpful in and out of class and wants students to succeed. Midterms were graded very quickly. Overall I enjoyed his class.
He is super cool and I havnt tried in his class AT ALL all semester and I'm ending the class with a B without studying at all.

Really awesome professor, he really wants to help students and give great techniques to you. For the application details, he can demonstrate extremely clearly and reasonable. And your grade for application and lab report are all based on the TAs and your lab-professor, so you can not say that's his mistake.

Dr. Ratcliff actually cares about his students unlike some other professors. He took the time to learn our names, and would actually say hi to me in the hallways. He was very reasonable when it came to grades, helping out students where he could. If you have a chance to take his class or even just talk to him you will be glad that you did.

The 1181 curriculum is the same no matter which professor you get, but Dr. Ratcliff is a great choice. He was very passionate about engineering, and he had a particularly good instructional team. His lecture was via PowerPoint. Also, he was easy to contact via email. He had our midterms and final graded pretty quickly as well.
She's actually the best professor I have ever had. She cares about everyone, and if you put in the effort, you can get an A. I also genuinely learned the material.

Very very nice, gives corrections and extra points. Tests are pretty straigh foward you just have to put in the time/effort to study and topics which can be hard to understand at first but she is very helpful in office hours

Really awsm prof and class, ended up getting 100.1/100 finally in class. Keys r: Do hw by urself, utilize test corrections, office hours. The final had lot of extra credit so don't worry abt it. Prioritize the 3 midterms which were not hard but content heavy, just once again do the hw and make sure u know how to do every problem. u cn succeed ezily

Professor Dupaix is a very caring professor who wants her students to succeed. She provides answers to HW assignments in order to check your work, and tests are very fair with many opportunities for corrections. Probably one of the best engineering professors I have had.
She is amazing! I had her for ME 2010 although it isn't an option on here. My best lecturer for ME so far.

She was truly such an amazing teacher. You could tell she really enjoyed teaching and wanted students to do well in the class. Her lectures were sometimes overwhelming with the information but she explained it well and gave detailed notes and practice. She let you correct midterms for points back and gave very good comments on anything she graded.

She's one of the best professors I've had. She answers questions very well. Homework was easy, midterms were tough but fair, and if you did the homework and practice exams that she posts, you will do fine. She's very caring and is able to relate with her students. Additionally, she allows midterm corrections. Make sure to do the work.

The nicest professor I have had at Ohio State. Prof. DuPaix absolutely cares for helping students truly learn the course material. If you want an A you are going to need to work for it though. Most of the grades are weighted in the exams and the course is uncurved besides getting half back with midterm corrections (does not apply to final).
She is so nice. Homeworks are VERY easy. Midterms have 50% revisions. And she's just really nice!!!!!
Professor that cares about her students doing well, but struggles to teach difficult concepts. Tests are tough but corrections are allowed.
Best Professor I have ever had, interesting lecture with useful examples. Give back the midterm quickly and provide useful feedback. Give extra credit for correction.
Participating in classes was a waste of time. Also, the required book, written by the professor, was not helpful at all.
The professor is not accessible outside of the class. She makes you to hate FEA class with useless/hard hws
THe class was not organized at all. The labs and project are not useful, so you spend hours and hours on one of the project without learning anything.

The professor makes you to buy her own book which is not very useful and be ready for the typos in the book. She is learning the softwares along the student so do not expect her to be helpful. The tests are too hard for only 50 minutes. Canceled the classes/office hrs because of her personal problems. Do not take her class if you have other options
Dr. Dupaix is reaaaally good at being there for students. Just participate on the discussion page and she will help you enormously. Highly recommended professor!

She is a VERY good teacher. Really good at explaining how to do problems, and homeworks were a good practice for the exams. Her exams were fairly easy, except for the final. Homeworks were often slightly hard but the exams were never as hard as the homeworks. Very helpful in office hours as well.

Such a refreshing professor who always walks into class with a smile. She is extremely friendly and dedicated to teaching and helping you understand the material. She is phenomenal at explaining the subject matter clearly! You have to work for your grade, though.

Not as easy as she says, its a grad level course and for an undergrad like me, it was a lot of work. The course is 50% home work and 2 mid terms of 50%. It is tough, get ready to do some real work and learn the material, finite element using ANSYS is gonna do lot of help in future, so take it
Show up to lecture and you are sure to do well. Very helpful in office hours as well. She will do what she can to help you.
Very clear in class when teaching as to what you need to know. Nice, friendly, and always in a good mood
She's a wonderful professor. Very friendly, tries to make things understand physically rather than just mathematically, great communication skills and beautiful :-). Highly recommended!
She is the best.
She is very nice but not always the best teacher.  She is tough when it comes to assigning grades at the end of the quarter.

Overall a very good professor. Makes class as simple as possible. Lectures wouldn't be so bad if they weren't at 7:30 a.m. in the morning! Tests are fair, same stuff straight out from the book and homework. Very nice and helpful during office hours. Highly recommended!

Dr. Joll was an amazing professor that made my FEH experience much less difficult than it had to be. The classes were funny, informative, and accompanied by useful activities. Even though I've never coded before, Dr. Joll was easily accessible outside of class to answer any of my questions.
Class was a lot of work, but Ethan made it very manageable. He gave great lectures, provided very clear rubrics, and was very easily and readily available to help both inside and outside of class.

One of my favorite Professors I've ever had. He's funny in a monotone kind of way and cares a lot about his students. Taught MATLAB,C,C++ and even though I had no coding background I did very well. Make sure to not procrastinate or it will lead to long nights before the due date. He is the best animator using power point there is.
Awesome teacher, recommend his classes.

Despite having absolutely zero experience with coding myself, Ethan Joll did a great job at teaching both MATLAB and C/C++. Although there is a lot of homework, it prepares you for the material on the quizzes and tests. Ethan Joll was the best, and would answer any questions that people had.

Very nice teacher and always really understanding when it comes to needing extended deadlines or anything of the sort. I liked him so much I made sure to take the 1282H class he was taking next semester. He is very entertaining and easy to talk to and overall a really good person.

The start of the course with Onshape (CAD) was easy b/c of his good lectures and clear rubrics (make sure to look at them for everything, don't loose points for random stuff and ask if you are unsure). For the robot portion it was a difficult, but as long as you have a good team (hopefully some of your friends) I think you will really enjoy it!!
This guy is the goat!!! He is such a good guy, and he is always down to help any students. I would highly recommend any FEH or FE students to schedule with him if you can!!!

He is one of the new teachers on campus, but is a really cool guy once you start talking to him! Don't be afraid to ask questions or talk about any circumstances, he is very understanding. He isn't a hard professor, it is just that the course guidelines make it hard.

New to the scene and tries his best. While a bit monotone and bland at first, they really show emotion later as they settle in and can be humorous at times. While not knowledgeable about SolidWorks, they offer great professional advice and give good feedback. Great 8 AM class.

He was just alright. At the beginning when teaching Solid Works, the way he taught was kind of boring and he didn't seem enthusiastic about it. He did answer questions well whoever asked and tried to help every student. He's a pretty lenient grader, and he got better over the semester. He tried to be more funny and enthusiastic as time went on.

Dr. Zhai is a solid professor! His style of going through examples is very effective, however, undermined by "cold-calling" to measure attendance. Fortunately, a 20% bonus is granted per the syllabus as an "optional" final exam (though you'll likely need to take it). Homework varies and can be easy to rage-inducing. Fine class and good prof!

Not a bad professor, but not an amazing one either. Lectures can be boring, but are slow and very well structured. Shang takes his time and stops for questions. Midterms and grading are very fair and doable. Overall, definitely one of the better professors I've had.

Sezen repeats himself a lot and usually runs behind on lectures. Examples were often given two days before the homework that relates to it was due. His exams are tough but fair usually with a C average. He's not the best are responding to emails but usually gives good help in Office hours. I don't like his no technology rule and not posting notes

Professor Sezen is a really good professor and super knowledgeable. He calls out students in class so be prepared to answer a question. He is not a tough grader at all and makes the class easier than it seems. Overall course is tough, but just ask questions all the time and you will succeed.

MUST COME TO CLASS, no exceptions.  If you're willing to do that, and to not use anything but pencil, paper, and calculator, you'll do well.  Fantastic lecturer, good methods, fair exams, incredibly helpful
Very useful notes and examples. Plays great music!
GREAT PROFESSOR, HELPFUL
Very good professor and a heck of a guy

Kelsea really cares about teaching and her students. She is extremely organized with her content and carmen page. She does a great job at preparing her students for exams and she will only get better as I had her the second semester she taught. She gives helpful responses in emails. The class isn't a walk in the park, but if you study you'll do OK!

She's very sweet. I took the class when it was her first time teaching it and she did a great job. The class itself was a lot of work and requires you to be interested in the topics, but overall not a bad class. She's also very responsive on email, which helps.
She went in depth on all the topics we needed to know for quizzes and exams, as long as you pay attention in class you will get a good grade.

One of the best professors I've had at OSU. Cared about us and wanted us to do well. Willing to help no matter what- before/after/during class, and even during exams. Really made an effort to make the class interesting and give us unique experiences (like driving a tractor, tours, etc). Easy HW, easy worksheets for points, exams are open notes.

Easy but time consuming, especially with graded attendance, lab, 11 homeworks, and 5 take home midterms. Lectures are useless except for the posted lecture slides which tell you exactly how to do every problem.

Very funny professor, although his lectures can be boring at times. He's very knowledgable and accessible before/after class. Attendance is worth 5% of bonus credit, so it's fine if you skip but I recommend just going since he does a better job of explaining the concepts in person.

This was Dr. Rahman's first year teaching here, so she is learning. However this class is CONFUSING. She never explains anything, and I learned nothing. It's always unclear what they want on assignments, the structure of the course is overall a hot mess, and there's a lot of busy work. Lectures don't feel important to attend, but are mandatory.
Very much cares about his students, however the course is a bit disorganized and the material can be hard to understand.
This is a difficult class but he is such a sweetheart and cares about students. Homework is worth a lot so you have a good amount of fluff points if you do bad on an exam.

Dr. Kusaka is a gem. He genuinely cares for each student, takes his time to explain each concept in detail, and is effortlessly hilarious and inspirational. Homeworks and exams are very reasonable, and his expectations are extremely clear. The class is more math/theoretical heavy vs. application-based, but still a great course.

Amazing Professor, really cares about the student's and makes very reasonable exams. Stopped class once after he noticed we weren't asking/answering questions, and asked us if we were tired/needed a break and we said yes and he finished the example and told us to take some time off for the rest of class.

Dr. Kusaka's transport 2 (SP2020) was fine. He's good at explaining the difficult material, which is the whole class. He isn't the world's most engaging prof, but he is easy to follow and very straightforward. His exams have very few surprises, and the examples & homework prepare you well. Very sweet guy who definitely cares. He curved us up a bit.

I had Dr. Kusaka for 2420 (AU18) and 3521 (SP19). He is a refreshing change within the department. He uses the chalkboard rather than PowerPoints, his homework is only due every other week, and answer keys are neatly typed rather than handwritten in cursive. His exams can be rough, but he curves generously. I felt smarter after taking him. 10/10
Excellent Professor

After the first unit most of the things he goes over in lecture are related to the homework and exams but without going to TAs for homework theres no way you could do it. Covers very few exam type questions in lecture. Understand how to do the problems on the practice midterms and go to TA office hours and youll be fine. Very generous curve.

This was the weirdest class I've ever taken. For the first month I didn't even know what we were covering. Then Dr. K Mr. Miyagi'd the heck out of me and everything we'd learned just kinda fell into place and made sense. It went from my most hated to my favorite class in like a 24 hour period. Weirdest class ever. Go to the TAs for homework help!

Kusaka is an amazing professor. The material that he's teaching was difficult but he explained every single detail in such a way that even I could understand (says a lot haha) Go for TAs for homework, he curves pretty generously, watch out for his third and/or final midterm as it could be pretty tricky. You can tell he's been in this game forever

Kusaka is a funny guy.  Go to TAs for homeowork because it is worth a decent amount of your grade.  I read the book but I don't know how helpful it really was.  Homework isn't in the book so you don't really need it.  Study homework for tests.  He does give a pretty decent curve.

Incredible professor. Had him for transport I and II When we finished transport II the entire class gave him a round of applause. The topic itself is incredibly difficult. However professor Kusaka explains it very well. Exams are difficult but similar to HW and in class examples. Gives generous curve and inspired me to be a better person.

Dr. Kusaka is a fantastic professor. He does a great job of explaining very challenging concepts and takes extra time in order to help his students. While his tests were extremely difficult, he curves generously. He does not mean to be funny most of the times, but his train of thought ramblings can be hilarious. Definitely take his class!

When I walked in the first day, I thought Kusaka was going to be ridiculously difficult, but he is actually one of the better professors I have had. He takes the time to go through multiple examples and clearly explains everything. His tests are generally fair, except for one bad question that is usually straight from the book and very specific.
Had him for thermo and transport and had amazing examples and his tests were difficult but the class was curved.
Great professor. It may be hard to understand him initially because of his accent. But it gets a lot easier later on...exams are hard especially final. Really need to know your stuff.
Very hard to understand, and assumed you knew stuff!!??

Great guy.  Super helpful.  I thought he spoke English just fine.  At first I thought he was a bad teacher, but soon realized it was the material that was hard to understand, not him.  I would take him again.
No Comments
Very difficult to understand.

He sometimes didn't state things that would otherwise be seemingly obvious, but overall good lecturer.  He had some language barriers thought, like I didn't think he understood what a study guide was.  He sometimes took us for dumb, BC its a lower level class.

Dr. Toney is very knowledgeable and helpful. Since this class is so standardized, he doesn't make many of the assignments, but he knows them in and out and helps efficiently with any problems. 1281 is a tough class, but Dr. Toney makes it manageable if you go to class and put in the work.
n/a n/a n/a n/a

He goes through his lectures very fast which does not help very much when trying to actually program for assignments very much. In this class, I tended to find TAs much more helpful than Toney. He's not a bad professor, just nothing outstanding from my personal experience.

I had Professor Toney for the self paced online ENGR 1221 class. Class was fairly easy given that you paced yourself and regularly used resources. Virtually guaranteed to get an A if you complete all assignments as you can complete them until you pass the unit. Very helpful and overall high quality professor.

Had him 1181 and 1182 (online for 2020-2021 school year). He made concepts easy to understand and was a clear lecturer. He was available outside of class. Toney is a great guy just 1181/82 are so workload heavy its annoying. He made the class easy and the material was not too difficult.

Organized class structure. But have fun clicking through 4 tabs to actually see the whole assignment instructions and rubric. Relatively easy to get a good grade (but large courseload). Lectures are not particularly helpful with the assignments. Somewhat cold with students and unhelpful with team problems. The TA's saved this class.
James Toney is a clear lecturer and very precise with the requirements for assignments and class work

He's a nice guy but this does not help how awfully this class is structured. There is no instruction and hours of busywork. Unfortunately, the class is required for all engineering majors so if you can try to find a more engaging professor.

Dr. Toney's lectures were really useful in completing all of the assignments. Projects and exams were straightforward as long as all of the exercises and applications were completed and understood. Communication of details at the end of the semester was somewhat weak.
Very thorough, clear, and concise. He is very fair in grading and accommodating.

Professor Toney has been a very helpful teacher for my learning. Very clear and often replies to emails very fast. This class is a lot of work, but thanks to all the resources and help provided it is not too hard to do well.

Dr. Toney is a great teacher. He can be a bit stale in his lectures, but if you pay attention they really, really help. He was always available through email to answer questions. His class improved my Matlab skills immensely.
His lectures were difficult to follow because he just read from a PowerPoint instead of actually teaching.

Very knowledgeable and provides clear presentations with lots of in-class examples. Assignments can be hard and take a long time to figure out, but he is more than willing to answer questions and help you through it, so start them early. A tough, but very caring and fair professor.

Good professor, willing to answer questions, super hard content, and lots and lots of assignments until you feel as if you are drowning. He makes the wording of the hw, exams and exercises way harder to understand. If you want to take this class, find a buddy asap!!!

Lectures can be boring, just showing examples, but they were easy to follow and the notes were posted online so found that I didn't need the lectures. His class is laid back but will take a lot of time out of your week doing the assignments.

ENGR 1181 is a VERY time demanding course for supposedly being 2 credit hours. Dr. Toney is a pretty chill teacher. His lectures were very boring, but, there's no way to really make lecturing about Matlab interesting. Most grading is done by TA's and they follow a rubric that you have access to, so as long a you follow the rubric you'll be fine.

He's the best. Super chill and nice. His class is relatively easy, noted that you do the work. MATLAB is MATLAB, regardless of who teaches it. Having said that, he is so great and I would highly recommend his class

The lectures were so incredibly boring and she went over the class end time on numerous occasions. The material was easy to learn, but the notes/examples she would post are very hard to understand. There is a small curve at the end of the class.

Not a great professor, lectures were fairly disorganized and it had some level of a flipped classroom aspect. You are expected to read fairly useless slides before class then questions in class. mainly excel focused with homework taking 2-3 hours. Only nice thing is that exams are fairly straight forward with a long time to do them online.

Lectures were super long and didn't feel very informative. All tests and homework online, so it's easy to do if you pay a little bit of attention and check back in notes. Extra credit if you answer more than the required amount of poll questions on zoom lectures

The sessions were long and terribly boring. The homework and assignments were time-consuming. The tests were GRUELING. Yes, this was an online class, but I heard the in-person equivalent wasn't better. I got the impression the professor knew her stuff but didn't know how to teach. Just glad it's over.

bombed the first test and immediately dropped and I will take it with Sandy instead. i think hannah is a new professor so imma give the benefit of the doubt and say she is still learning. office hours are horrible and poorly managaed, dozens of students waiting for one person. TA was not helpful.

Professor Smith was okay, the way she lectures can be hard for some people to learn from. Class is quite boring and there aren't many assignments. She is very understanding and gives students 2 “late tokens” for overdue assignments. There is no final exam, just a final group project.

Dr. Smith is a fantastic professor. She really knows Matlab and is gives helpful advice/ tips. She is also super accommodating and understanding - just work with her to figure something out. While learning Matlab is not much fun, Dr. Smith brought a much needed levity and snarkiness towards the idiosyncrasies of the program.
Paul cares about all of his student's learning and teaches in a fun and engaging way.

"A pointer
is a variable

the address
of another variable."
Great at teaching and super funny too. He made a difficult class the most fun one I've taken. Textbooks were offered, but I never bothered to read them since the same material was covered in class anyway.
Amazing guy. Genuinely funny and cares about the students.

Best instructor for this course; you'll definitely get an A if you submit all the work and it's done competently, but you'll have to pour in tons of hours outside of class to finish the assignments in the first place.

GOAT. Amazing lectures, super caring, funny, and understanding professor. Make sure you go to class, if you Fundamentals of Engineering is a hard set of courses, honors or not, so be prepared to do a LOT of homework. His lectures helped me a lot with understanding how to do homework. Very nice guy
goat
Good teacher, tells jokes during lectures to keep it entertaining

My only gripe with Professor Clingan was how hard it could be to hear him at time in the class especially if you sat further in the back. Overall, he was a wonderful teacher, note that the readings and paying attention in class are extremely beneficial especially if you have no background in computer languages.

Very fun lectures and labs, however, this is a LOT of work for a 2 credit hour class. None of it is exceptionally difficult, but you're at the mercy of the teammates that you are assigned. Paul is an incredible professor and makes the class very fun to get involved in, and my lab team became some of my good friends. Highly recommend his class

Paul was one of the kindest and most resourceful professors that I have had thus far at OSU. He truly cares about his students and makes the at times boring content more lively with his humor. He offers great advice and is willing to sit and help students with various assignments!
Clingan is a fantastic, funny, and caring professor, and while the course is very difficult as is, Clingan does his best to make it as manageable as possible.

I had Paul for the FEH Nano project and definitely would recommend him. He is super laidback and has an extremely dry sense of humor. He's pretty approachable and cares about his students. Even though he's not an expert in nanotechnology/microbiology, he does his best to help you through the project along with the TA's.

Paul made a class that I was scared to take fun and mostly not overwhelming, even though it was a lot of work. He is funny, kind, genuine, and considerate. He always checked in on students for questions, comments, and concerns, and he actually listened and provided help or solutions if there were any. Even online, he was a fantastic professor!

Paul is just an awesome guy. FEH is a tough class both semesters, but he cares about his students and does his best to help you succeed. I thought he had a great sense of humor, and he was always available when I needed help.

FEH is a demanding course. With that being said, none of the problems I had in the class were with Clingan. He is an amazing person who deeply cares about how each and every one of his students is doing in class. He has a ridiculous amount of office hours too. One problem is that sometimes he moves a little fast, but his other qualities redeem him

Paul Clingan is an excellent instructor. I highly recommend him for the first year honors engineering courses. Most of the instructors chosen by FEH are of high caliber, and Clingan is no exception. There will be a lot of homework, but if you pay attention and go to class you will learn a lot.
Awesome dude

Mr. Clingan is a great professor. He knows the class is a lot of work regardless of how it's taught, so he makes it as bearable as he can. He lectures for about half an hour at the start of lectures and the rest of the time is yours. If you have any issues, he will do anything within his power to fix them and genuinely seems to like teaching.
You must stay on top of all of the work to pass this class.
Great guys, willing to help you if you need it. I like his sense of humor, his jokes help make the tough project a little more bearable. TAs do most of the grading.

ENGR 1282.01H is a very time consuming class for 3 credit hours, but it isn't very difficult in terms of grading. The robot project was very time consuming but not nearly as much as you may have heard. As long as you do the work you should get an A. The beginning SolidWorks section was fairly difficult though.

ENGR 1281.02H has a lot of homework, but as long as you do all of it you should get an A. The course is fairly standardized so your lecturer doesn't matter too much, but I found Clingan's lectures to be boring with too much forced "comedy". You can skip half the lectures and still get an A, however, as the content is fairly easy.
Would recommend. But NOT the .02 version. The advanced programming simply assigns more work. It will NOT help you learn more programming. Definitely just take 1281.01
Paul is a good guy, loved his class. Would recommend for FEH.
He's an good lecturer and overall great dude.  I don't remember the content in the class being to difficult.  He's very supportive during the extremely intensive robot project.

I had Paul for ENGR1281 and the robot project. He is absolutely hilarious and really easy to talk to. One of my favorite professors at OSU. His lectures are short, so be prepared to read the slides before class.
All around great guy. He wants you to succeed and truly cares about his students. He's super funny too. Really nice guy.
His videos about C and MATLAB  were the greatest pieces of art to ever grace my eyes. FEH is hard but Mr. Clingan is a great instructor.

Paul's a really good professor to have if you are being introduced to programming.  He spends most of the class walking around helping people after a short lecture.  TAs also were very helpful and personable.  Highly recommend his class, that being said, it is difficult and you better be ready to get Bs and Cs on things  you worked very hard on.

Paul was my favorite professor last year. He was so funny and helpful on everything and truly tried to get to know each of the students personally. He was clearly intelligent and loved helping students. I ended up changing my major out of engineering but I would take his robot class again for sure! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

Paul has been by favorite professor in my first year at OSU. Extremely funny and really wants to get to know you. The 1282.02H class was challenging in terms of workload but Paul truly does his best to make it easier on the students. He's very supportive and always there for you. Overall great professor.
Paul is hilarious. He wants to help you learn.

Had Paul for first semester of FEH and Robot. Excellent teacher! His quirky sense of humor always makes class enjoyable. Probably one of my all time favorite teachers. If you are getting ready to take robot, have fun with it. It was the toughest, most rewarding, and most enjoyable classes I have taken.

Paul Clingan was my favorite professor I have had thus far in college! He was great at explaining the topics, making examples that were fun and interesting to the students. He has a dry sense of humor, but his jokes are hilarious and he will crack multiple jokes throughout the course of the class period. He and the TAs were also very helpful.

Class was the easiest I had first semester other than survey.  Paul makes it short and sweet during lecture and the class is easy to get a good grade in as long as you keep up with the assignments.  Worst part of the class was my TA experience, watch out, they don't want to help you.  Ask Paul directly when you have questions if you want help.

He "teaches" for all of 25 minutes of the 2 hour class and then left.  The TAs were the only ones there to help, but they always had to reference the key to help with questions.  You can go to his class, drop off your homework, and leave.  He does not care if you are there.
A terrific professor. Humorous, understanding, down to Earth. Truly a pleasure to have as a faculty member. Love this guy!

INCREDIBLE! Paul makes everything extremely clear from day one and is always willing to help. He is very knowledgeable in all matters regarding computers and he also makes class fun! You will likely hear between 5 and 7 great jokes per class period and taking this class at 8 AM was definitely a great way to start the day.

Great teacher. Makes everything extremely clear and is always willing to help. Each class starts with a brief lecture for about 10 minutes and he probably cracks about 6 or 7 great jokes in that time. The class was enjoyable, even though it was a lot of work. Lab reports were tough but you will make it through alive. Welcome to FEH.
Great professor for FEH. Really, really funny and helpful! Made class interesting and kept me awake for lectures even though it was an early class.
A good teacher, though his competence with the advanced stuff leaves a little to be desired.

Mr. Clingan is an excellent professor. He always keeps class moving and interesting. He was sick one day, and another prof. filled in. I could see a difference right away - I was weak on that day's content all the way through the final exam. The lab reports are strenuous, but spreading out the work eases the pain. Get Clingan if you can.
Awesome instructor! Very good sense of humor so I almost always enjoyed class. I'm definitely not a programmer, but he made it possible to succeed. I'm really glad someone recommended him to me.
ask about sexy halloween costume

Paul was a pretty nice guy before class, but once we got to London he started to give everyone a hard time and would offer almost no advice for what to do. I felt as though I was intruding on a personal trip and that he didn't have time for me. If you have the chance to go to London, GO. Just we warned.
He was an amazing teacher. Best I've had yet. His teaching style is really helpful and He makes the dry stuff interesting.
One of the coolest teachers I've ever had. He made the class much more interesting than what it might have been. Highly recommend taking a class from him!
Great guy, quite hilarious, and really enjoys teaching. Very helpful and approachable. Would highly recommend
Awesome teacher! Best I've had in engineering so far! You are very lucky if you get him. He is very approachable and helpful...a great teacher overall!

Clingan is a boss. If you can get him you should he is probably the best teacher i've had at ohio state because hes funny and is such a good teacher its almost hard not to get an A in his class. Nice guy, heck of a teacher. GET HIM

Fantastic teacher. Im not a great programmer but he made things easy by doing real examples on the board instead of muttering through slides already available to us. For all you engineers next year or in future years, make sure you get him. You won't regret it.
God of a teacher.  without question one of the best professors in the business.  Programming used to be hard, this guy fixes everything.  unbelievably amazing.
He is a great teacher that keeps the students interested.
He's a really great professor!  He is helpful and you can tell he cares a lot about his students.  Also kept the class lighthearted and fun even though it was stressful and a lot of work.

Really good professor with a real interest in students.  Will usually always be available to help students who may be struggling.  Some assignments can be difficult, but with the TA help and him around they are easier.  Highly recommended!
Really good professor.  No bull attitude.  He knows the material, and will get through the lectures quickly.  The course wasn't that interesting for me, but he definitely knows his stuff.
He keeps the class fun and light hearted, but the room temp tends to make me want to fall asleep sometimes.  He has an interesting sense of humor though!
He's far and awya my favorite professor. Let's face it, FEH material is exceedingly boring and a pain. At least you can have a teacher who is great to be around!

Awesome prof.  Took him for 192 and 193A.  Willing to help you out of class as much as needed.  In 193A, stayed every day towards the end of the quarter till 7:30 if we needed help in lab or on HW.  TAs like him, you will too.  Everything is reasonable, able to say something in different ways.  Best FEH prof, period.

Professor Clingan is bar none the best professor I've ever had.  He is extremely helpful and cares for his students.  And I'd be willing to bet you he's got a dirty joke to beat any one you've got to tell him.
he is wonderful
Great prof, comical, teaches material well in a "no-bull" fashion, very friendly and approachable, good TA's, knows his stuff
Very helpful, like chipotle, always a plus, gives an opportunity to ask any question in the world at the beginning of class
Baldilocks is my hero
Great teacher!
Nice Guy...Chipotle lover, very helpful, has good TA's!
Bald and Awesome
extremely helpful, funny as all get out, knows his stuff, the one class i could never fall asleep in
Really nice guy, chipotle fan as well, cant go wrong! really helpful, willing to work with students after class, on off days, made this uninteresting subject doable
Great class, very helpful guy. He'll bend over backwards to help you get through the quarter. Go with Clingan or Freuler for your FEH courses. Great profs.

Paul is a great teacher & a cool guy. He has a self depracating sense of humor that's pretty funny. Don't copy someone else's journal entry though! Even though they're worth like zero points That gets you in trouble.
Boring lectures make me sleepy, but other than that he's a good guy, knows his stuff, and down to earth.
Took for a 2 hour matlab course.  Really easygoing nice guy, very clear.  Class had no homework and was easy easy.  Get this dude!
proves that there are actually engineers with a sense of humor.  nice guy, and a good teacher.
Paul lets you call him by his first name because he wants you to be comfortable talking to him and asking for help.
great professor.helps students and understands them.
Good professor. Will work with students out of class if they need help. All-around nice guy.
hes just a great guy, and a great prof.
Easy class, get this professor.
Very good teacher, knows everything about the subject, extremely dedicated to his students. Great Guy, loves Chipotle!
Really good lectures and very caring professors. He wants you to succeed

Very good and nice professor. He knows his stuff. Make sure to ask for help if you don't understand something and he will gladly explain. Lots of lab reports, but it's not Casale who teaches the lab, so to me that was almost like a separate class. I would take again, and hope I have more wonderful professors like this in the future.

Lectures are so boring and honestly kind of useless. Attendance is mandatory and graded. Really nice guy. U will not get ur grades back on assignments for significant periods of time. Class is honestly not hard but there is just a decent amount of work. If u do the work u get an A.
Casale helped my team figure out their issues and it really helped us come up with a cool prototype

When our group approached him about an issue with one of our members he barely helped. Also avoid this class at all costs. I'm not even an engineering major idk how I ended up in this class. This will be the single hardest class you will take in all of college. Some people think he's a good professor. Different experience I guess.

Dr.Casale is really a great professor. His online section can be a bit shaky, but that is not his fault. This course is a lot of work, and he does his best with offering a crazy amount of opportunities for you to do well. If you put in the effort, you will do well negative reviews are for those who didn't try. Cares deeply about his students.
A great professor who genuinely cares about his students and wants them to succeed. Professor Casale is easy to talk to and willing to help. I would definitely recommend taking a class with him.
Great teacher. Lots of homework, but that's because of the course not him. The final project really helped the grade.
avoid this class
He's a really nice guy and helps out whenever you ask.
Not the best lecturer, but understanding, kind, and respected.
Incredible caring, very helpful and respectful. Genuinely wants every student to get an A and will help as much as needed.

Dr. Casale is a caring, intelligent, and extremely knowledgeable professor. Unfortunately, due to personal reasons I couldn't complete the class. However, if I could, I'd pass with an easy A. Sure there's a lot of assignments, lots of "busy work," but it's plenty of easy grades to pass with an A. If you can't pass, it's on you.

Aside from the group projects, I loved the class and loved Dr. Casale. He is a very interesting person and always tried to give a personal example of a concept covered in class, such as presentations that he had to give for his work, or papers he had to write before he was a professor. Definitely recommend, just be ready to work in groups a lot.

Dr. Casale is a cool guy, and he is very passionate about his job! He makes the class less stressful and is really chill when it comes to projects and presentations. He is so kind and loves to interact with students. I wish I could have taken this class with him in person, he seems like such an amazing professor who would be even better in person!

Casale is the BEST professor. He is genuinely one of the kindest profs I've ever had and I would take his class 50 times over. The setup of ENGR1181 leaves you with a lottttt of assignments, but he does his best to help you and make them manageable. If you're taking him, stick with it!! You won't regret it.

Dr. Casale has definitely been my favorite professor so far. He was a big heart and cares about all his students equally. He truly wants you to succeed and will gladly help you. Lectures are not the most engaging but that's more on the course material. His background experience allows good feedback and ideas. 11/10!

A very kind professor who cares about you succeeding in the class. Group had difficulties turning in an assignment and ended up turning it in late. Had a conversation with him and he was very understanding and waived the late penalty.
Dr. Casale is a great professor. He is so helpful and he actually cares about his students. You wont regret taking his class. He is the kindest professor around!

I took the Montaña de Luz service learning class to Honduras with Dr. Casale. The whole class became really close on the trip and I couldn't have asked for a better leader. If you have the opportunity to take Dr. Casale for any class, do it. He really cares and you will have a new favorite professor.

Dr. Casale is amazing. If you're reading this, you're lucky you are going to have him. If you have a choice for your 1181 professor, choose him. I came into this class not evening knowing what programming is and I got 100% on my final exam without doing much outside the class besides the applications. Strongly recommend!

Dr. Casale is a very caring and understanding professer, he truly wants his students to do great in the class and does all he can to make that happen. Even with 72 students in his class he tries to talk to everyone on a personal level. His lectures could often be very dry, but that may be more because of the content.

I cannot ask for a better instructor than Casale. He has a very big heart and inspirational lectures to make sure his students succeed in the class. If you get to know him well, you may consider him as a second father. He is also willing to give you a big hug and useful advice if you are in trouble or need some help.

I really love Dr. Casale! Very kind and helpful, a father-figured type that will provide you learning, researching and real-world experiences without spoon feeding his students . I wish there were professors like him in ECE Department.

Dr. Casale was a great fit for this class and really brought our project together. Helped just enough to push us without doing it for us. This class was the best I have taken at OSU and he was a major piece of that. Always inspiring and interested in helping students with anything.

I took ENGR 1300, would often come to class unprepared and would sometimes end class after 10 minutes for work time. I felt I could do the entire class online asynchronous and still get an A. Other than never responding to emails, the content is outlined well and his rubrics are self explanatory.

He would have students turn in drafts and give very good feedback that made it easy to score well on the final copies. He would also change due dates if he had fallen behind in any capacity. It was a very low stress class with good, practical writing experience, and he was a very kind professor.

relatively easy english GE. he has drafts due for every assignment (automatic 10pts) to give feedback for when u submit the real thing. his grading is semi-hard but if u ask him questions he will tell u what to fix. the last part of the course is mainly a big group project so make sure u have a good group, its presentation, visual art, a long paper

Great professor. Funny, flamboyant, colorful, super caring. You'll never feel intimidated by him. Gives pretty simple feedback to your assignments, just do what he asks and it's both an easy A and an easy course credit. Group projects so be ready for that, but he's always eager to help. Would absolutely recommend.
A lot of works. Instructions are super unclear, so you may get lost on assignments. Lectures are super boring but short. Not an easy A for a writing GE 2367 class.

You can tell in lecture that kimo really cares about students. Hes a chill guy and offers a ton of opportunities to ask for help. Rubrics are vague, yes, but there are drafts for everything that give you 10 automatic points and he also gives exact feedback for the final draft. Not strict with deadlines and grades easy. Easy ge with minimal work!

Dr. Tichgelaar is a really caring guy. His rubrics are somewhat vague, but he gives great feedback on rough drafts so you know exactly what to do and its no issue. If you have a question, I would recommend office hours over emailing him to get a faster response. Overall awesome guy and awesome class. Great preparation for later in life. Take this!

Not complaining because the class is too difficult, its really easy if your keep up with the work, but the problem is that Tich gives very vague directions on how to complete assignments and then marks people off for missing out on stuff he never explained. He grades kinda tough as well and likes to knit pick on things.

He is a really good professor but my only catch is that the class is a lot of work for a GE, really only with the group project. It's much longer than it really needed to be and the asynchronous class content is extremely long and not very engaging. Would't take again but he isn't bad. Its mostly just how the class was structured and the project.

Class itself isn't any more fun than your other classes. Slightly more work than what you would expect in a GE course, but is still pretty easy. The group project can suck big time if your group doesn't help that much. Kimo is a pretty cool guy and is always willing to help when you need it. I would take this over the summer though. Save the stress

Interesting teacher but seemed very disorganized. Due dates are changed without notice and assignments are created sometimes without making it clear. Nonetheless, the stuff he teaches is pretty good for the most part, like the resumes, cover letters, and follow-up letters! There isn't too much work and it can usually get done without much effort!

- He is a very odd person. - Does not respond to emails until a week later. - He has assignments hidden from the Modules and Grades pages so you'd have to look at the To-Do list that's only on the Home Page, the little thing on the right when you click and he doesn't tell you about that anywhere in the course/class/syllabus.
Not understanding, very weird. Does not give clear instructions for assignments and response time for emails are very slow.

He's great. He dresses like he thinks he's doctor who, but he is a very funny and interesting person. Everything he taught was useful to the course or to our careers in general. You will like him. He grades pretty easily, but don't take that for granted- what you are learning has a good chance of being important to you at some point.
He's a great prof! He really prepared me for writing resumes and cover letters. His class is easy and you will learn a lot!

Professor Tichgelaar taught very well and this course is very useful (CV, Resume, Memo). The only thing I want to mention is that there are so many papers. We need to finish about 27 assignments in the whole semester. If you already have a heavy schedule, don't take him. If not, please take him. Soft grader & Helpful teacher!
lecture is long and boring. not clear

Kimo is the man. If you do all of the work the class is an easy A. You turn in a draft for each assignment and he gives you feedback. If you do what he says, you'll get an A. There are two major group projects, make sure you get with good people or you'll be doing a lot on your own. If you're ever confused, his office hours really help.

Odd dude, but friendly and helpful. Lots of busy work in the class, but nothing really hard. Few group projects to be wary of - try your best to get a good group.  Attendance is taken and skipping classes hurts your grade, so make sure to show up.
It's engr 2367, it is easy with any professor. Kim is the man. He has a very flamboyant personality  and a great sense of style. He alway seems enthusiastic to come to class. Would recomend

He made probably the most useful and applicable writing class for engineering majors.  Much better than having to take a random writing class with long term papers or something completely irrelevant to engineering.

Strange neo-victorian style steampunk dude. Nice though. The class was stupid and boring. The assignments were stupid and boring and busy work. Not a tough class at all, but just took time that I didn't quite have to do the assignments.
Quizzes are vague and assignment due dates are switched around a lot. Assignments overlap quite a bit too which makes completing them difficult at times. Assignments were fairly easy but long.
Lacks clarity in what he wants you to write about. Quizzes ask very subjective questions. Very boring. Do not recommend.

He grades papers strictly and he doesn't really teach what we are supposed to write. Even though he gives extensions to due dates, he teaches us little and wants us to write everything...do not recommend him.
Highly recommend his second-level writing course. Overall, a great and informative class. The professor was very helpful with the assignments and material, also making the lectures engaging.

Jack is genuinely one of the best professors I have ever taken at Ohio State. His lectures can be long and be prepared to put in the work for presentations every single week. However, he truly cares, he's funny, and has amazing energy.
Had Jack for two courses back-to-back ISE 6801 and ENGR 6210. Great instructor, great person, genuinely cares that students learn what is being instructed.
You can tell he doesn't take life too serious. Attendance wasn't mandatory I literally showed up because he was just a cool guy and his class wasn't boring.
amazing

ISE 3800 really should not be a semester long. It is all very basic knowledge, and I really did not learn anything this semester. Tests are worded extremely poorly, causing people to get bad grades on very easy subject matter. To improve, I recommend that Jack take the GTA-created tests before giving them to students. They are awfully worded.

He is a very nice person--extremely personable. Material covered in class is straightforward and will be applicable in any professional context. The class is really easy if you've managed a project before. Exams are not well written, and a few students did badly on them even though the material covered in class is not particularly challenging.

Professor Slavinski was a nice and caring guy, but his tests were tricky even though they were on easy content. I bombed midterms, but would go into the GTA and get some points back. The professor cares about real world applications and not so much about grades. Attendance sheets are passed around at every lecture/lab.
Jack is awesome

Jack is a great professor. Getting a good grade is secondary to him to making sure you leave with something valuable. If you decide to go in and not be involved in the class and just pass, you're not going to get anything out of it. But if you decide to put forth some effort and get to know Jack he's a great connection to make and you learn lots.
Pretty easy grader, most of the stuff was common sense. Do the readings and you will get 100% on the quiz. I didn't do them but still got an A in the class

They need to figure this class out...it's a joke. All of the material covered in the course could essentially be covered in about 4-5 hours of lecture..but it's a whole semester. Shouldn't have studied for the final. Everything stemmed from basic knowledge but the questions were so poorly worded that you didn't know what was being asked anyway.
Good use of industry knowledge

He was by far the chillest professor I had with numerous extra credit opportunities and make-ups in case you miss couple classes or due dates. It's sad that he's leaving, but we can all appreciate his work for creating this ECE 2360 curriculum in a way that is fun and easy to learn about circuits (and ofc not having to take 2020).

He did a great job teaching the material, and we got a lot of hands on exerperiences through in class activities and fun labs. There are 5 quizzes, the lowest 2 are dropped, and no final, just a final project. I think he plans this to be his last semester, but if not, definitely take his class.

Clayton is awesome. I struggled with circuits because it usually relies on physics and math to teach instead of the practical applications. He focuses on the practical and now I actually understand components of a circuit and the circuit itself. I hope he doesn't stop teaching, he's good at it. Otherwise, I hope you sail the world Clayton!

The GOAT. Clayton made electronics interesting to a lecture hall of CSE students and often told interesting stories of his sailing expeditions. Super knowledgable and also extremely flexible when it came to assignments and grading. Lots of extra credit. Definitely one of the best professors I've had at OSU.

A cult of personality among his students, Professor Greenbaum does a wonderful job at making microelectronics an accessible and interesting subject without making the course content rigorous. There are many different hands-on labs and simulations which gives students a breadth-focused view into a wide array of ECE-related concepts.

Excellent instructor who makes the course engaging, though it could be slightly more challenging. Grades are based on five timed home quizzes, with the lowest two scores dropped, in addition to homework and at-home labs. The hands-on nature of the assignments makes them quite enjoyable.

Prof. Greenbaum is a dawg. You must take this class over ECE 2020, there's no question. He's a super interesting guy who truly cares about his students. There's a decent amount of homework (including take-home labs) but the work load is very doable. He always makes himself available outside of class as well. 11/10 as a person and as a professor.
One of the best professors I've ever had. Extremely knowledgable and was an honor to have him as a professor.

Amazing professor and amazing person. Extremely kind and favors learning above all else. Favors "hands on" style learning and is extremely flexible. Very funny and charismatic. Only criticism is that he might be *too* easy going, but I'm sure a student was saved by that. Couldn't recommend him enough.

Peter is one of the lab lecturers for FEH1. He doesn't help that much during labs; he is not prepared for the labs, the TAs helped a lot more. Post Lab rubrics are kinda vague and not easy to understand what to write for the weekly report. Some labs are confusing, but most are really fun! LOTS OF WORK for post labs.

Professor Motoyama is very knowledgable, but he was difficult to reach outside of class, and did not give great feedback. Lectures were interesting, and the projects were pretty easy. Sometimes class was boring.

Dr. Motoyama is clearly knowledgeable in his field and is passionate about the material, just not passionate about teaching it. Labs are essentially follow-along lectures with no explanation or clarification. He will try to evade office hours. You will be learning the material on your own for projects. This class was harder than it should have been

Very focused on his own work and only does the minimal to teach students. Will refuse to expand on lectures. Expects students to know exactly what he want in reports and grades harshly if it's not correct. Doesn't respect students ideas or opinions.
Tanner was the best teacher I ever had at OSU. Totally recommend
Strict grader. Takes points off for the most minute details.

Horribly boring lectures but really easy homework and 6 mini exams throughout the semester. Thankfully he posts the slides online so it's better to just read that than listen to him. I practically did the course asynchronously and it was easy.

Pretty decent teacher. He makes the course very accessible with your schedule which I loved. The only gripe I have is that his course is designed to do most work when you have time, yet he has participation quizzes which must be completed the same day. This makes it hard to work ahead OR plan to do course work later.
Super easy class overall. He has six mini exams which are a breeze. Just take him.

(SPEAKING AS A CSE STUDENT) He posts all lectures so watch in 2x after and download the completed slides after. Don't read the book. His slides are the most clear and concise slides an OSU professor has ever made. HW's don't ever take longer than 30 mins, mini-exams abt an hour, maybe 53.5 hours of work (including watching lec) per week for an A+.

Valco is a good professor, although his lectures can get bland really quickly. He assigns a lot of homework but they are pretty easy to do, so definitely find a friend in the class to do them as it makes it so much easier. He gives 9 mini exams instead of finals and midterms, and they are pretty easy if you study beforehand. Overall a solid choice

Lectures technically aren't required in the syllabus but he always gives quizzes during lecture, which add up to a lot of points. Lectures are the worst I have ever had, this guy talks so slowly and will read every single word on the slide. Half of what he talks about is stuff that we don't even need to know. Homework is pretty easy though.

George is a kind dude and a decent professor. Very reasonable overall with expectations. Lectures are a little boring but get the job done and are catered to the homeworks/exams. Exams are fairly easy; Make sure you understand the homeworks. A straightforward A/A-, but you need to put the work in. The book is very helpful.

Valco is a decent choice. There is a lot of homework and reading, but this supplements the lectures well. Exams are similar to homework, but he is particular on answers provided. During online classes, he provided recorded lectures and many office hour times to get feedback. Online exams allow usage of notes with 1% late penalty if turned in late

One of the worst professors I have ever had at Ohio State. He takes all his lecture material straight from the textbook and reads word for word off his slides, and if you ask a question in lecture he doesnt even know how to answer it. Homework is long and not based on his teachings. Exams always have one question over something we never learned.

His class overall wasn't difficult, but lectures were terrible and hard to follow. Slides were a wall of text, or else a diagram with a million arrows and components. The only saving grace was that the homework and exams were fairly easy. As long as you know the basics, you'll be fine for exams and won't have much trouble with the class.
He can't teach to save his life, but at least the material isn't brutally difficult.

Prof. Valco is one of my favorite professor. I enjoyed his class, lectures are a little boring but they are understandable and very useful for homeworks , tests are similar to homeworks and to his class reviews. And also hes a fair grader.

Hes a nice guy, but by far the worst professor Ive ever had. Reads directly from the screen and barley explains anything. Literally, does not explain a single thing. Lecture is not even worth going to but will occasionally have in class quizzes which forces me to show up.
I came to an understanding that the quality of OSU is really bad. Basically, you can add Dr. George J. Valco to your blacklist.

Overall worst professor I have had at Ohio State. Reads word for word off of his slides without elaborating or explaining the more difficult concepts in this course. His slides are also an exact copy and paste from the book. And to make it even better, he puts questions on exams that dont resemble anything in the book or in his slides,

His slides are just copy paste from the textbook. He reads from the slides word for word with no addition explanation. If you ask a question, he just rereads the slide without ever explaining it in a new way. Awful professor, avoid.

Brutal Class. Tons of homework, and a ridiculous amount of material covered, but I've never learned more in a class. You'll walk away from his lectures super confused, but the homeworks help a lot with understanding. Office hours and Review sessions are super helpful if you don't want to spend hours trying to piece everything together for homeworks

Valco's class is comically bad. There is way too many assignments and the lab doesn't even serve its intended purpose which is to teach you about fabrications processes. Every week you are turning in a pre-lab, post-lab, and class homework assignments that takes several hours. This is due to a large disconnect between lectures and assignments.

Take a class with this man only if you are passionate about the material and willing to teach yourself everything. Does not do examples. Notes and (terrible) book do not contain information needed to do homework. His class is structured as if you already know the information and he can't be bothered to attempt teaching how to do problems.

Lectures were long, homeworks were difficult, and tests were very time constrained. Every student in the class used homework solutions, and the tests, while slightly easier than the homeworks, were very long. The highest grade for the midterms were always 1-2 questions away from a full grade, because nobody was able to finish them. Avoid Valco.

The work in Valco's class is really heavy, demanding more time than some of my classes at the 5000 level. His homeworks are very long and you will need to use them as practice to pass his exams. Exams are difficult but not impossible. He is clear in his lectures and quite informative but lacks enough practical example. Recommend avoiding his class.
No way! That's it! I had enough!

Don't know why the bad ratings. He is a great teacher but do not expect an easy class. If you want to learn then he is a great teacher. Tells you right off the bat what he expects from you. He is a harsh grader but overall well worth it.

Good luck if you take 3020 with Valco, the average in my class when all was said and done was a 40%. When we started there were 80 people in the class, at the end only 44 remained. And Valco refused to take this into consideration when he "curved." One person got a .1/10 on a quiz. Why bother give .1 of a point. He just seems cruel.

Valco is a nice dude, he is respectful and clear.  You are going to do terrible in his class, though.  I've spent about 9 hours on all of his 13 homeworks, and pulled all nighters before his exams.  I got the third highest overall grade: 77%.

If not for his tough grading he would be a forgettable, average professor.  As it stands I've started referring to him as Valco the Impaler.  His exams are tough, he grades tough and he is not afraid to flunk half the class.

Valco teaches directly from the text.  Unfortunately, Microelectronic Circuits by Sedra/Smith may be one of the most useless texts I have ever used.  Valco is tough as nails.  His course policies are reasonable, but he is not exactly helpful.  The course is taught like it is presumed that one already understands the material.

He is incredibly tough when it comes to exams and homeworks. He throws tons of material at you and expects all of it to stick. The averages for the exams and overall class were horrid but he curves slightly. Avoid at all costs unless you are truly obsessed with microelectronics!

OK, so here is the truth on this guy. He has a bad reputation for being hard and deserves it, but he is not a bad teacher. He is very organised and really knows his stuff.
