cool guy. insanely large amount of work but he can't control that. Department controls the class. He grades quick and gives good feedback.
Love this teacher!!

Very helpful and knowledgeable with the subject matter. Will always work to stay in contact out of class. You need to attend class, though. It isn't mandatory, but if you get too far behind with assignments it will be impossible to catch up.

FEH is a truly quantity over quality course. So much homework, labs, and tests its ridiculous at the beginning. The coursework gets lighter though as the semester goes on. Brooke was a solid teacher that was willing to answer any questions I provided and went into depth on it. Responds promptly to email and is approachable.

I took first semester FEH with Brooke this past year. The class was difficult because there was a lot of work with a heavy emphasis on coding. Brooke tried her best to explain but sometimes it was hard to follow. While she may seem intimidating at first, she was pretty understanding and the TA's were willing to help too.

Brooke was fine during the first semester, but taking her for the robot project was a mistake. She favored certain groups over others. The favoritism showed up in the grading. The graphics portion was taught well, but after that ended the class got worse. You can get a lot of help externally from her, but it's hard not being one of her favorites.

FEH was overwhelming going into and had a lot of grunt work up front, but it really taught me a lot. Brooke is a really nice instructor and was happy to help, especially if you showed up to her office hours. Dont get discouraged by tough grading, especially in the beginning. If you do the extra credit assignments, youll be fine.

The class is listed as 2 hours, but only the first hour is required. The class covers stock useless powerpoints and then you do the homework. There is homework every night and lab reports each week. This class takes up a ton of time and really doesn't net much. Brooke is super helpful outside of class, but the inclass stuff is useless.

Overall a good professor.  Her lectures were sometimes long and at times confusing, but she is very willing to help you understand if you have questions.  Class is a lot of work but you should be able to get an A or B as long as you do all of the work.

Good professor. Lectures can be a bit confusing at times but she is more than willing to help clear up issues in my experience. Attendance not mandatory but homework was turned in everyday in person, so you probably should go. Homework nearly every night. Class was a lot of work but I got a lot out of it. Fair difficulty. Helpful if you ask for it.

Definitely a caring guy, heavy French accent but like most accents you get used to it. His class wasn't too hard, mostly because you had all the tools you needed to succeed, which I liked. Just make sure you are comfortable with his exam r3views

He is the kindest and most understanding professor I've had in my 4 years at OSU. The class isn't necessarily difficult as long as you study previous midterms, and homeworks aren't too bad but they're not easy. Attendance is worth a good chunk of the grade, so skipping class isn't really advisable.

He offers no derivation/intuition/examples. He just shows his slides, reads them, and skips through them as fast as he can. He went through 18 slides in 15 minutes and still managed to go on tangents. He also gives his conference talks for presentations. Midterms are copy-paste from old ones but the take-home final was pretty difficult.

The man knows the material well, he can answer any question you have. Homeworks are book/ADS based. Midterms are copy-pasted from previous ones, so study those. Pick good lab partners, there is a large amount of lab work to be done. There's a take-home final but it's long and difficult. If bored, count how much he says "essentially" in one lecture.

Professor Roblin's class is not really easy to follow up unless you study the material in advance. His accent plus the way he expresses things make it hard. But if you ask him questions, he always can explain amazingly well. Most importantly, he has some connections with the industry and will recommend students who get the good grade.

Prof. Roblin is  a very kind French with very thick accent.  The lecture is not very hard so you will make it without taking the classes.  Though his clarification is not that clear, he really knows the course well! He has some cooperation with companies and you may get the training if you have good grades. Recommend to take it.

Overall not that bad of a teacher considering the class. His french accent is pretty thick, but he knows the material real well he's just not great at explaining it. The homework is completely different from the exams. He copies and pastes a lot from past exams and online quizzes so study those and you ll be fine
French accent is really cumbersome. He really knows what he is teaching but he is not an expert to express them out. Tests are easy

Roblin is a great teacher once you can get past his accent which isnt that bad. He really knows what he is talking about I called him out on a few things and he knew exactly how to answer it. He teaches from slides which is annoying but he can derive any of the slides. Very nice professor that gives you practice exams similar to the actual exams.

His French accent actually makes him my hardest to understand professor. The class is really easy and his midterms are nearly identical year-to-year. He gives you old ones and lets you use them during his midterms so you don't really need to learn the material, and if you do it's largely on your own. Nice guy, though seems kind of ditsy.

His first exam was hard,few of the problems was similar to examples in the book,about 65%similar to the review sheet.Second one was easy,95%similar to review sheet.Grading was easy for both.Final was hard,half of it was from the new material but the other half is from the new materials(the very hard part).Each one of them was 25%.You must take him.

Professor Roblin is a very kind man, but unfortunately you will not learn a thing in his class.  The exams he gives you to practice will be the same as the exam you take but changed slightly.  Homeworks are easy as are the exams.  If you want to actually learn the material I would recommend a different instructor.  Easy A otherwise.
Roblin's cool.  You won't learn a thing but his classes are REALLY easy.  Don't bother going to lecture just study the old exams he gives you.

Tally from one lecture: 50 "essentially"s, 38 "isn't it"s. The highlight of the class was when he started talking about the RF potato. You learn absolutely nothing. He does wear a nice little scarf when it gets cold, though. Put it this way: there was a waiting list for a 700-level ECE class, so everyone could get an A, incl grad students.
On 5/16/07, Professor Roblin said "essentially" 27 times in 20 minutes.  He's a very nice guy, but you won't learn anything from lecture.

Very nice man with kind heart. He is extremely harmless but unfortunately, you don't learn anything from him. I didn't learn anything in this class, but I still expect a good grade, for he is very easy!

Like the last review, this guy is a worthless prof I must say.  It's sad because he is a nice guy. He tells you what's on the midterms and final, you don't have to learn anything and you are almost guaranteed an A in here.  I totally blew this class off. (also teaches ECE 482)

Couldn't understand a word he said.  I stopped going to the class in the second week because he lectures off of slides from the book.  Easy midterms, more difficult final, but he curves very well.  Easy, easy, easy A

This class is the definition of busy work. Loads of homework after every lecture. The homework is short and not difficult, but there are just way too many assignments. She is all over the place during lectures and her notes are hard to read. Overall, class is fairly easy but be ready for interesting lectures and lots of homework.

Not the best lecturer but she made this class so easy. I skimmed the textbook sections before I did each homework and had a pretty easy time. There are so many points and also assignments that get dropped so its easy to do well.
Dr. Anderson is an incredibly caring and funny professor. This course was well-organized and her notes corresponded to the book. She records all lectures.

Betty Lise made this class easy as hell. She was funny and quirky as well. If you actually want to learn and retain this info, read the book or watch youtube videos. All I know is, if you want an easy A while remembering some things, take Betty Lise.

She made the class easy to succeed. Sometimes I found it difficult to decipher concepts in class that could've been explained better. Lots of homework but not particularly hard. The labs were easy. She did her best and cared about the students. Don't take that for granted.

She's very humorous but her lectures were hard to sit through as they were in a huge auditorium and she often made mistakes. Way too much homework too. But she was very helpful during office hours and genuinely wanted you to do well in the class

Betty Lise was a funny lady, and she set up the class in an attempt for it to be not too much to bear. She was not great at teaching, and despite my grade, I did not feel I came away from this class understanding the content well. The class was pretty easy and finished early though. Labs are tough, but they are out of her hands.

The overall content of the class was pretty easy, although the labs were extremely annoying. She went extremely quickly on the material, so I did not feel I was able to learn the material well. She assigned a lot of homeworks early on, but that slowed down as she ran out of content. She was ditsy and funny. Her lectures were hard to follow.

Man, where to begin. This class is relatively easy, but the lectures were so bad I only watched snippets when the textbook was not clear. This was perhaps the worst class I've ever taken (taken 4+ years of school) and most of that blame is on the department. She was a fish out of water from day one and felt bad for her situation.

Honestly don't understand anyone rating her low. The class is easy as hell and if you can't find humor in watching an old lady crack open a diet coke and riff about circuits for an hour there's something wrong with you.

*cracks open a cold diet pepsi*

Too much homework and the lectures were pretty unorganized. The textbook is much better for learning the material. Despite all this, the class is a pretty easy A if you put in the time to working on the endless homework assignments.
Good professor but way too many homework!
Messes up a lot of problems during lecture. Notes are also messy. Gives a lot of homework due Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. As sweet as Betty is, I dont recommend her as a teacher.

Class is easy overall, lab is tedious but fine.
She mess up a lot in live lectures so it is much better to watch it later.

Betty Lise Anderson is such a great professor and an even better person. She is very accessible and you can tell she cares deeply about her students. She is willing to make accommodations and is very funny. Her handwriting is a little hard to read at times, so I recommend paying attention to what she says

Dr. Anderson was fine, but she is very hard to follow/disorganized. She's a nice person and she's caring about her students, but learning the content from her is frustrating at best. I found the book a lot more helpful than she was for learning the content. The exams were basically like the homework, and there was a lot of homework.

Betty has been one of my favorite professors at Ohio State. Her lectures can be all over the place and there is a load of homework. If you use the book and her lecture notes side by side this should be one of the easiest classes you'll take. She is very charismatic and can always make your day better just showing up to class.

Professor Anderson is an extremely nice, personable, caring professor that does her best to make her lectures enjoyable; but she is so incredibly unorganized and makes a ridiculous amount of mistakes during lectures. This course is so extremely homework heavy; I believe there were roughly 75 homework assignments in one semester.

Nice and humorous. Also knowledgable. However, she is not as great with explaining concepts or presenting the material in a way thats easy to understand. She is unclear about what you're supposed to understand and her complicated lecture notes often get you lost. Luckily there were ways I could get help, but I wished lectures were more engaging.

For someone not in the ECE major, I feel like she the pacing is off(teaches too fast on hard/rushes through ez content); although people ask questions, she does not spend enough time to clear confusion during lecture. Many students have questions. On the bright side, she is fairly good at making sure lecture doesnt extend past the listed time.

Mixed reviews of her. On one hand, she has great energy and her class is set up so you cant fail if you turn in your (40+) hws. Its busy work. She gives MT examples and open note exams. However there are later sections where you will teach yourself (book is meh). Lecture is optional and recorded but shes easily flustered. Easy A if you try

She's not bad as a professor, has good intentions. But she also makes frequent mistakes during lectures. Students always end up correcting her. Hw is useful when studying for exams but some of the questions feel like busywork and the exams are actually a lot easier than the hws.

Betty Lise really cares about her students and makes it very easy to succeed in her class. However, she frequently makes mistakes in her lectures and solutions and isn't always clear about explanations. The last unit was very difficult and I only got by because we were allowed one exam drop. The class was overall pretty easy but not well taught

Caring and friendly woman. At the same time, I didn't think she was the best. Heart is in the right place but she's confusing with her notations in logic and doesn't explain stuff clearly. That follows from her assigning homework at the last minute. Luckily, the lectures are recorded. Definitely helped!

Betty Lise Anderson is a funny and open-minded professor. However, on her class I merely could understand what she's talking about when her lecture is so confusing with logics. And her singing and cheering during the class made it harder for the student to focus. I met her several times stuck on her own problems. Rather go Youtube, save your time.

I found her to be very energetic and enthusiastic while teaching. Cares about students a lot. I also found her to be ill equipped to teach the class though. Simple concepts were made way too confusing when she could've just taught shortcuts that would help beginners. Class isn't hard but other sites helped dummy down the material in class.
One of the worst professor that I ever had. She struggled teaching this course and made tones of mistakes during the lecture. I recommend taking it with someone else if you want to learn

This course was not well organized. Although Professor Anderson wanted her students to do very well in her course she was not well prepared for her lectures. She gets lots in both simple and easy practice problems in the lecture. It seemed like she did not understand what she was teaching in the course.

The course was so disorganized. The professor did not know what she was doing, and was unprepared and had some technical difficulties. The homeworks and the midterms get graded almost at the end of the semester. and tons of homework every week. And they were not able to grade all of the homeworks. I highly recommend taking it with someone else.

A good and helpful professor. Take her for any class you can. She is fair (no tricks or slave work involved to get your college credit). You will gain career skills you will need from her. Anyone who says take wu lu or valco is steering you wrong on purpose. She can be funny.
not my style, not a fan.

She is my definition of easy - her tests are based directly off of the homework problems.  The homework is easy, as it is based directly off of class problems and the book, which she wrote btw.  In office hours she will pretty much show you how to do any problem you don't understand.  Go to class to learn the conceptual problems.

Sweet class.  Seriously, if you get a chance to take it (lasers) with her, do so.  Very energetic, unlike some other solid-staters I could name (Valco, Berger, etc).  Can get somewhat murky and difficult, since there are some difficult topics, but she does all she can to help.  Exams and homeworks are fair and largely qualitative.  Take it if you g

She's a pretty good teacher. She doesn't know as much about the material but she's enthusiastic. She's easy to follow excpet when she goes off on tangents. She goes on ECE tangents alot since that is her specialty. Grading is all the TA's so it's hard to judge her easiness and if you're asking for help you're probably better off asking the TA's.

ECE331 is crammed full of material, so the professor has to move quickly, but she managed to get it all in. She writes very quickly on the board, but encourages questions. She is a little rude in office hours if you don't know what you're talking about, and her textbook is absolutely terrible. She's one of the better 331 professors, but still hard.

Easy class. Anyone who thinks the HW or exams are excessively tough is an idiot.  She will give you the HW answers if you ask, and the exams are very easy.  In all, I missed a total of about four points during the entire quarter.

Great teacher. It's refreshing to see a professor enthusiastic about her job.  Makes a boring and tough topic interesting.  Exams are straight forward from class notes and, like posted by others, she will give answers to HW questions in class. Do your HW, brush up for the exams, and you will do fine.
Don't listen to the ppl below, I took wu lu for 331, and i didn't learn a thing.. 331 is supposed to be a tough class. She is a good proff for 716, she's crazy so it's enteretaining.
No Comments

Too Many homeworks and tough exams for a 300 level course. Avoid taking 331 with her if you dont want to  screw your grade. take it with Lu although you wont understand a word he says in class but you would end up getting a good grade.

Worst handwriting, no notes available online, make a lot of mistakes in lecture, goes very fast, care more about covering all topics rather than student's understanding, unbelievably long and hard exams, homeworks are too long. This course doesn't connect with any of ECE courses. ALWAYS take Wu Lu for 331 or 432, no Valco or Berger either.

Wow this prof is CRAZY!  She is soo funny in class and it keeps you interested.  Very clear, nice and helpful.  If you go to class you are golden.  HW's can have a few tricky problems but she will help you (read: tell you the answer) if you try it first and ask in class.  Exams are straightforward!  SOOO much better than others for 331 trust me!

She's CRAZY, but in a good way.  You'll learn the material annnnd you'll get a good grade if you go to class.  Homeworks are kind of tough, but exams are very straight forward, without and tricks.  Definitely recommend her over the other 331 professors.

tough  and too many homeworks, very tough and highly conceptual mid terms. U can do really badly even if youve studied the book and her handouts well.Lectures dont help you to solve homeworks or midterms at all.In short avoid taking a class with her if you dont want to screw your GPA.

Honestly, this guy is a legend. He is so knowledgeable and cares a ton about his students. His course is challenging but respectable. 

If you get the chance, take ME7384 for Hybrid Electric Vehicles

Dr. Rizzoni is a good lecturer and world class expert in his field. I enjoyed the first part of the class, which was taught by him but assignments were just too long. be prepared to read and re-read the notes because the material is just too dense and overwhelming. I learned a lot but this class is no walk in the park

The first half of the course was taught by Rizzoni.He gives you an overall picture of how stuff works and lets you fill in the details.The course was heavy with material and he goes through all of it quick but you still understand what he is talking about.No tests.Homework is heavy requiring a lot of time to work on but course is very interesting.

I actually enjoyed this class. Rizzoni does a good job at lecturing and his modules that he has assembled are helpful. Homeworks were tough but helpful for preparing for the exams. Busy guy though, so really all office hour interaction was with Dr. Chiara, who was great. Tests were reflective of material covered, ave of 68, 86 and 64 for the exams.

Better avoid this guy..makes you work like hell and more and more  work. Longest homeworks, very bad...thumbs down...make a differential equation wrong and you end with 10 points on 40.....fits in more than what a quarter can afford, finals damn hard.wish I had DETRICK

I was not thrilled to have him having used his error filled textbook in ECE300 and ECE320.  Then I found out we don't have a textbook for this class.  The notes are not clear and don't have enough examples and you don't even have a book to help you out!  His notes come straight from the modules which are ok.  This just isn't my topic.
Makes system dynamics as clear as it can be.  Takes a practical approach towards everything.

This is one super hectic course and it's only worth 2 credit hours. So pathetic. Sundeep tries to make the course easier for the students with the tips and tricks he provides after the labs. Very responsive even on weekends and times when he is off. Think it's his last semester of teaching.
The class was very easy, however his communication with students was horrible. He never answered my emails and the lab assignments where completely unstructured with no directions.
despite being a remote class, Sundeep did a great job explaining the material and giving us ample amount of time to work on the labs. One of the best I had this semester.
A lot of work and a bit hard to understand. Not a lot of empathy in COVID. Instructions in class are a bit hard to find if forgotten.
Cares a lot whether we understood the graphics related content or not. Very accessible and easy to approach! Great lectures and sends weekly reminders of important things

Sundeep is by far one of the best people in the engineering department. He genuinely cares about his students and wants them to succeed, and will go out of his way to ensure they understand the concepts. He doesn't hesitate to meet outside of class and provide you any accommodations to ensure your success. He truly is a great guy!
He is a good instructor, with great understanding of things from student's POV. Easily identifies the mistakes or issues we face and explains them to the class.

1182 HAS 2 INSTRUCTORS ON RECORD, ONE IS A LECTURER AND OTHER IS A GTA. My instructor (Schrock) is very disorganized in terms of carmen scheduling and grading. When we brought this up to Sundeep's attention in a class he was leading, he immediately got it rectified, and also gave us an extension on assignments. Good guy. Cares a lot about us.

Professor Ulstad was a very nice and knowledgeable teacher, yet her class was a pain to me. Some of the homework had wrong answers or incomplete questions and it would make them take twice as long. Otherwise, good professor but this got on my nerves. Would be 5/5 without this.

Professor Ulstad is the nicest professor I've ever met at OSU. Although the class was online, it was super engaging, and she seemed to truly care for her students. She broke things down and made things really easy to understand. She gave a lot fo real-world examples, which definitely helped a lot too. Definitely recommend.

Professor Ulstad was kind, and seems to care about the class. 

The course is very, very easy. Also very, very bad. Exams & homework assignments always had mistakes, & the lectures were incredibly long - the material could have been taught in a quarter (or less) of the time we spent in lecture. Lazy class. Waste of time. Nothing useful in ISE 2040.

Aimee makes it easy for anyone to understand engineering economics. Her lectures are quite straight forward, especially because she provides A LOT of in-class examples that will aide people in homework and exams. While the class content and her teaching style may be boring and repetitive, Aimee does a good job overall conveying all important info.
I took this class online but she was a pretty good professor. As long as you put in the work, the homework and exams are pretty easy and its not hard to get an A.

Literally my favorite human ever! I found this class so interesting and applicable. TA's are really nice and Aimee is happy to help. She just wants you to learn and if you put in effort she will notice. 10/10 recommend!!

Aimee is a great professor, but her class is so unbearably boring and uninteresting. I have flashbacks to econ because the curriculum is so wording dependent and which formulas to use are never clear. Homework takes a really long time to complete and theres too much of it. Aimee grades very fairly and gave ample time for all assignments.

The course is 2 credit hours, with lengthy weekly homework, pre-class quizzes due before each class, and exams that have questions that were never on any lecture material. The exams are open for 6 hours and most likely take you that long, with NO PARTIAL CREDIT. If one little number or something is off on a problem that takes you an hour, no credit

Her lectures are long winded even at 1.5x speed. Course materials have been uploaded late and every assignment has at least 1 question that is so poorly worded you will need to go to office hours, finishing homework early has never been so tedious. It's unfortunate because Aimee really seems to care about the course material and is very genuine.

I would definitely recommend Aimee for ISE 2040. She is very clear with expectations, and there is plenty of time to complete your assignments. She bases the class on what she's seen in industry, and she even mentions on the first day that the class is not meant to be difficult. As long as you do/understand the work, you will be fine.
Aimee is awesome even though her 3400 class is a bit heavy on projects. You will learn very useful concepts.

Very easy. Once you start an exam you have 8 hours to finish it so there is no need for you to study (it's an open book exam). The content is easy and all excel. The "big" project is ridiculously easy. She is very nice and wants you to succeed and learn. Kind of boring in class but you learn a little bit. Again, to emphasize, she makes it easy.

ISE2040 is boring but not hard - econ principles and straightforward plug-into-equation problems. There's one group project but if you space out the work it's not that bad, and she grades easy. Exams are multiple choice, so any questions missed will significantly affect your grade. Aimee herself is very nice, and teaches you what you need to know.

Aimee really knows her stuff. She's worked in industry for years and let's you know how the stuff you're learning will actually be applicable to engineering in the real world after college. There's not a lot of assignments in this class and none of them are hard. You can tell she's taught this class for a while and has the material down pat.
Big group project during the semester, she said if someone wasn't participating she'd give them a zero (and she did). Super caring of students and willing to help, very available outside of class
One of the best teachers I've ever had. 10/10 definitely recommend. Show up for class every day, there is usually a quiz.

The class was definitely not as easy as others say it is but there are so many opportunities for extra credit that you can easily manage an A or B in the class. The tests are multiple choice but each one you get wrong will hurt your overall grade greatly. The professor is really caring and helpful.

AImee tries to pack too much into this class, diluting what is actually useful. Lectures are 2 hours long and very boring, but don't skip because she'll have surprise assignments and tophat questions. Overall, she's a fine professor, but the class could be a lot better if it weren't so boring and group project based.

In class quizzes every day that are easy. Useful material. SHE IS SO HELPFUL! The GTAs were good as well. I thought what I learned will really help me. HW due twice a week. Be sure to go to TAs for Excel homework.

Aimee is an awesome professor. She does a great job of explaining the course material rather than just regurgitating it. She also gives you a chance to miss a few classes by putting her lectures online and dropping a fair amount of quizzes you take every day in class.

As far as classes in the engineering department go, this is about as easy of an A as it gets. She worked for anheuser busch and shell tell you all about it but its pretty interesting stuff. If youre an ISE major youll enjoy listening to her experience in the industry.

Solid prof. Go to class, she gives tons of hints. There's a group project where you do a case study. Pretty easy tests, easy class in general. She said she was going to use TopHat to do participation grades in class, but she never did. Seems to care about us learning something.

Aimee is an extremely nice person, but this was one of my least favorite classes ever. The content is boring (and lectures are 2 hours long), and Aimee regularly makes mistakes during her in class examples. As long as you review the slides and do the in class examples before the exams, you should be fine.

She doesn't lecture, she just kind of talks at you. This class is slow and incredibly boring. Also, the online homeworks were twice a week and painful to do. The content is not hard, the class just sucks.

The class is boring but fairly easy as long as you understand how to do the problems. Textbook is not necessary but you have to buy homework access. She is a decent professor and explains the material clearly. Exams are not very many questions so any question you miss will impact your grade significantly so be aware of that.

The course is short but the lectures can be boring. Purchasing homework access is forced but save yourself the money and don't bother with the textbook, it's not helpful in anyway. Forces you to do clicker questions from a phone app at random points during random lectures. The course isn't hard, just tedious.

Not many grades in the class, keep on top of the work. Aimee explains everything really clearly so just don't sleep through class and you'll get an A. Start the homework a few days in advance, sometimes it gets confusing and she'll give you the answer if you ask.

Lectures can be a little long and boring BUT she knows it and does her best to make it interesting and fun. She's one of the best when it comes to relating what you're learning to real world applications.

Prof. Ulstad is a solid lecturer. She is knowledgeable and always willing to help. She does assign a lot of busywork, but her class isn't too hard in the end. Beware getting a bad group for the group project. If you have to, you can do it all by yourself pretty easily.

The class itself is really easy. The best part is it is a 7wk course though lectures are longer. Aimee really wants to see you succeed in the course. The only drawback is the majority of students are incredibly uninterested.
Loved Aimee, homework was very helpful, test were fair. Very good at giving feedback. Absolutely hated the completely useless GTA.
Lectures were long, but overall an easy class. Had to buy online access for homework, but could've done without the ebook. Save some money and just buy an old print edition of the book.
Class is long and required so that sucks. But the course itself is very easy. Don't spend money on buying the textbook though, it's not worth it.
The classes is a little bit disorganized but when you get used to it, it will not be challenging. She is kind and not stingy on giving good grades.
Class was really straightforward and you will actually use this stuff in projects during the rest of your time here. She is an MBA and definitely knows her stuff when it comes to project analysis.

Not the best at writing questions, but her ISE 2040 class is very simple and straight forward so long as you show up to class and participate in the group project. Go to her office hours if you are struggling or unsure about the homework; she gives you the answers.
Easy class, come to lectures, study example problems and it's an easy AB+. Lectures are long but I heard that's changing to hour lectures so it should be a good class

She goes off on tangents and tries to use too many real world things that she doesn't test on so lectures get really boring. So happy this class was only 7 weeks. Test can be tricky so some studying required and the sunday hw help sessions were really useful.
Easy class.
One of the easiest class. Just do the examples. Class is very long, really boring, I find her office hour classes are more helpful.
Has no idea what she is talking about.  The only useful parts of lecture are the example problems.  Class gets long and boring but very easy.
Very clear and always willing to help with the material. The 4 hour lectures can drag on and become very boring though as she goes through example problems at a slow pace.
Very helpful

Prof Bakshi is super disorganized in lecture and posting material online in a timely manner. The homework rarely has information we learned in class and do not relate well to the exams, which is frustrating and extra time consuming. The class is graded heavily on exams and there was one a week before the cumulative final exam.

Bakshi is super passionate about sustainable engineering and that helped a lot with motivation in completing assignments; however, he is pretty disorganized and his textbook isn't always the most helpful for homework. Sometimes he would say something would be posted by a certain time and it wouldn't until days later. Overall, it was fine.

I took this class an elective and found it to be one of the most interesting and engaging classes I took throughout my major. Professor Bakshi is an expert in sustainable engineering and his passion and understanding of the subject showed in the lectures. Dr. Bakshi fundamentally changed the way I view and analyze the world.

This class was my favorite class I've ever taken in CBE, even with it being remote. Dr.B was engaging and cared about the students. He cared the course was valuable. If you put in the effort, the class is not difficult compared to others. His lectures were interesting and all aspects of the class were well organized besides a few technical diff.

The lectures are very conceptual and then you go to do the self-graded homework and they are in depth calculations, most weeks requiring the assistance of office hours. There is also a vague group project in which you are randomly assigned. Also, he calls you out in front of the class if you glance at your phone or laptop during lecture so beware.

I want to love him more (he's really passionate about what he teaches) but he is so unorganized. He'll take points off for things he didnt specify he wanted (for example: he'll ask for a table, you'll make said table, he takes points off because you didnt include a graph too, which he didnt ask for). Group project is heavy, not much guidance.

I actually think Bakshi is a pretty cool guy. A tad unorganized at times, but I feel like he actually genuinely cares about the students. Was always willing to work with the class in terms of rescheduling because of crazy weeks ( career fairs, other exams, etc.) The only thing I hated was the final worth 40 percent of your grade. Thats a lot...

The group project is terrible and requires you to work with unmotivated teammates on a project that should be assigned to a full-time engineer. The tests are almost nothing like the homework and there is no other study material provided. Don't take this class.
Good prof. VEry helpful.
Bakshi was the worst professor I have had in the field of engineering since I started at OSU in Fall of 04. He is unclear and makes easy concepts difficult.
Tends to make things overly mathematical which in this class disguises the potential real world value of the course. Didn't seem overly concerned about teaching, sometimes seemed unprepared.
No Comments
Gets the point across pretty well, but won't really help you very much.  He purposely gives you vague answers to make you think, which I personally found to be kind of irritating.
Great teacher. Easy to understand.

Dr. Qin was a very nice lady, but not the greatest teacher. Granted, she teaching an intro class and does not have much control over the course. Not expected to do much during lecture, and this course has a lot of busy work. However, she is super understanding and nice if you need her.

Dr. Qin is so sweet and truly cares about her students. Her 1182 class is similar to 1181, and you don't do much during lecture. She helped a lot when the team had issues since it is a team based class and she made sure everyone did a fair share of work or else they would be penalized. She is the sweetest woman!

Dr. Qin is a great professor. The class itself is a lot of work and can be frustrating at times, but she does a good job explaining material and is always available outside of class to give extra help. She's extremely kind, very approachable, and made this course the absolute best she could make it. Look carefully at rubrics and directions.

Prof Qin was amazing. I was nervous about taking her 1181 class because she wasn't on ratemyprofessors before this semester. She cares about students, is clear about what she wants, and is very flexible. I don't know about other 1181 profs, but I would highly recommend her. A sweetheart of a woman. Although 1181 is a lot of busy work, it is doable.
Super slow grading but its easy to do well. Super accessible and understanding of family emergencies and covid issues.
ENGR1181 is no fun, but Prof Qin makes it better.

First of all, Professor Yang is a great guy. However, he absolutely sucks at teaching this class. He just reads off of slides during class and his exams and homework hardly ever match up to examples that are given in class. Just a lot of work overall, which is stupid because it is never exactly clear what you are supposed to be learning.

Not a hard class to get a good grade especially for a CBE tech elective. His exams and homework are easy. That said, I would definitely take another class if I knew there were multiple research papers in the class and a 15 page final report and presentation. Super time consuming.

Dr. Yang is a decent lecturer.  In office hours he is very helpful explaining concepts and going over exam problems that you didn't understand. Sometimes he is willing to give you points back if you have a sound explanation.  The exams in this class are fair.
Cool guy. Tests are long but not too impossible. Probably seems a lot better if you had Dr. Ho the previous quarter.
Enjoyed every lecture. She puts in effort for her students and if you do the same, you'll have a great time.

Rachel is incredible. She leads a lot of events in the Humanitarian Engineering Scholars program. She is very understanding if you need extensions and is very helpful if you ever have questions about OSU or engineering. Also she sent all the HES students cards in the mail with our favorite candy bars before Christmas. Super sweet prof.

Prof. Reano is really difficult. Not only are his classes tough, his lectures are math heavy and not incredibly helpful. Many homeworks, a midterm and a final. On top of that, he is very hard to reach via email and doesn't often respond I would not recommend him and his courses if you have options.
Teaches a lot of maths in the class and gives a lot of homework. 25 class lectures had 13 homeworks with a midterm and a final. I will say too much work for a graduate level 6000 course.

Professor Reano is a terrible teacher. His lectures are short and don't provide enough information to accurately do the homework. This requires a lot of time out of class reading the book and looking up tutorials online. AVOID!!

Professor Reano is flat out terrible. His lectures are between 10-20 minutes which seems great at first, but after a while you realize he doesn't explain the material enough to accurately do the homework. This leads to a significant time needed to teach yourself the material in order to do well on the homeworks and midterms.
God-tier professor.
Turned around my feeling on electromagnetism, really cares about the subject and goes out of his way to be meaningful in his lectures.

Great professor. Attending class if a MUST. Class periods are full of information which you could get from the book, but Reano boils it down and makes easy to understand. Just go and write down everything. The exams are tough, but he's a fair grader. By far the best professor I've had at OSU so far. Cannot recommending this professor any more.
Top notch professor. He makes tough material easy to understand. Thanks to his awesome class notes and the way he's organized. Would definitely recommend.

Reano is definitely a very fair professor. His explanations are usually crystal clear and he is always willing to help you in office hours. However, it is important to note that his notes in class differ from the textbook and he sets his own homework questions. Attending class is a MUST to get his notes to do his homework and exams.

Prof Reano is a really smart guy. He is also nice when you ask questions. He is fair to his students, I actually understand and like his characteristics.I will recommend this prof if you can take this class with him.

Professor Reano is an excellent instructor.  This has been my favorite class in ECE due in large part to his teaching style.  He makes difficult material easy to understand.  The hws/exams are challenging but fair.

By far, one of the best professors the dept has. He made difficult material easy to understand. Get the textbook b/c he heavily relies on it. Very easy to do well in his class if you go to class b/c his exams have problems done in class. Great guy, easy to talk to.
He made tough material easy. Awesome teaching and good interaction on class. Grading on HW and exams is fair in general. Good Professor!

His grading is too hard.I got the final answer correct on one of the problems but I wrote some extra stuff that was wrong then he detucted about 75%of the points.You need to read the book.Try to practice on the problems at the end of the chapter.For the final you need to be familiar with the lectures afer the 2nd midterm.2nd MT is harder than 1st.

Very good lecturer, makes difficult material seem easy and clear. I was not a fan of how he graded; takes off major points for minor errors and gives almost no partial credit. In the end though, the grading scheme was very fair. I would recommend him for this class, especially if you're interested in emag.

Makes emag clear and seem like child's play. Uses the book heavily, and does a great job of giving the "big picture" of emag, which is what the intro series should be all about. His exams are very easy and fair - and usually have at least one derivation question from the notes on them. I feel very prepared for future emag courses due to Dr Reano.

Took him for 312 and 694H (now 717).  Really wants students to learn the material and make connections between basic concepts and practical applications.  Takes tough material and presents it in a manageable fashion.  I would not have specialized in emag if I hadn't had Reano to explain the basic concepts so well.

Reano is certainly one of the best professors in the ECE department. He's clear, confident and encourages class interaction. No question or answer is a stupid one to Reano so speak up in his lectures. Homework and exams are extremely fair and do a great job of encompassing all material covered. Ohio State is lucky to have Reano.
Awesome professor. Had him for 311, 312, and now 694H and would definitely take more if taught them. Just make sure you go to class, he will often used examples from class word for word on the exams.
Very nice professor, gives good examples questions and homeworks and exams related to it.

Excellent, excellent prof.  Very clear lectures in EM, which can get kind of abstract.  Totally fair hw - refer to notes, occasionally books.  Very fair exams I found middle-easy.  Left us well prepared for 312, which he didn't teach subsequent quarter.  Very willing to help during office hours esp, in Caldwell or ESL.
Excellent in office hours.  Tests and homework were related to lectures.  He taught from the book (major plus).

A new addition to the ECE department and a very wise choice!  He made the material clear and easy to understand and SPEAKS ENGLISH.  Most of the HWs can be done by just referring to your notes.  Final exam was hard, but graded very generously.  Excellent prof for a very tough class.
new prof, well prepared likes to teach, hw and exams very challenging but he's very helpful in office hrs, he helps you do hw in office hrs otherwise the hw is very difficult. overall a good prof
Good teacher, a lil too much work though.

Dr. Harper wasn't the best at communicating content, lectures would run a little long, and often the information covered wasn't relevant to (or at least not the full picture of) what you needed to successfully complete assignments. She was nice and very passionate about the work everyone did though, which was especially refreshing online.
Dont know how shes this low. Shes really friendly and approachable. As long as you follow along in class you should be good.

Dr. Harper was very understanding of the difficulties that came with online learning. Lectures generally went over the required readings, and could be a little slow. There's enough interaction to keep you awake, though. There was 1-2 homework assignments each class. Paired with the readings, they took up a lot of my time. Great teacher, though.

Had her for 1281 and 1282. She was very nice and had a fun class. She was always there to help and made engineering enjoyable. Only problem I had was that she would lecture for a long time. Sometimes it was fun but I'm a person who can't concentrate during lectures and wanted to get to work faster. But everything else was great.

Robot was one of the most stressful experiences of my life, but Dr. Harper made sure we all maintained our sanity. She gave us great advice throughout the semester and is super easy to talk to. I'm so grateful to have had her as my professor for this course :)

Robot was difficult but Harper was awesome. This class depends on the TAs you get, too, but I don't think you can get a bad TA in the FEH department. f you ever need help with anything, she is willing to provide it. She also helped develop the course and is in charge of a lot of it so she knows what she's talking about

Dr. Harper is a really great professor who genuinely cares about her students. I had her during the FEH robot project and she always made an effort to talk to each group and give suggestions about how to improve their robot. Also she'll let you use her as a reference so that's a plus.

My favorite professor from my first semester. She really cares about the students and is always very helpful. She told our class there was no reason we shouldn't all get A's. I had no coding experience coming in, and she explained everything so it all made sense. If you do the work for this class (there is a lot) you will do fine.

FEH is standardized to the point where it barely matters who your professor is, but if you've never coded before, Dr. Harper does a good job of explaining the concepts, even at 8:00am. The TAs answered almost all my questions, but Dr. Harper was always happy to help. She really cares about your success, and she's very understanding.

Shes a good lecturer. The course is very work-heavy, and sometimes she lectures for too long, meaning you have to do more homework outside of class, but that would be my only complaint. Shes very clear in her teaching and all the assignments, and shes always happy to help you out, in or out of class.

Took her for the robot project.  She was always willing to help you out no matter the problem and wanted everyone to succeed but the class itself was a huge time consumer.  Great experience and amazing professor.
Dr. Harper is excellent at explaining concepts; she has a way of breaking them down to help you understand both the details and the overall picture.

I really liked Dr. Harper's class. She's always willing to help with engineering and physics if needed. She made class really enjoyable. Knows her stuff and is great at teaching it. You use a flipped classroom approach which is super helpful for this course. TAs help out a lot and do most of the grading, so hope you have awesome TAs like I did.

Dr. Harper is my favorite teacher so far at OSU. She is really helpful and wants everyone to succeed. Her class is hard, but it was my favorite freshman class. She is awesome... I would definitely recommend her to anyone!

Dr. Harper was an amazing professor. She not only is very clear in her lectures, but she is also very wise in her "grand scheme of things" advice. She's not easy, but that's because the class isn't meant to be easy. Terrific person all around.

Dr. Harper was one of my favorite professors. She is very knowledgeable about not only the class material but also Physics (use to your advantage). In her class you will get the grade you work for. I am also taking her class for the second semester of FEH because I enjoyed the atmosphere she provided.

Her jokes are rarely funny, and very (very) little is covered in class. The lecture is literally 20-30 minutes, and then you do homework in class.  You will have to use outside sources as no notes are provided on Carmen. The TAs grade the work, but if you follow the directions it is easy to get full points. The quizes are easy, but not the midterms

She seems like a soccer mom. Her TAs grade not her, so as for her 'easiness'. It's up to the TAs and i unfortunately had super hard graders. She seems like she gets exasperated easily. She let me put her down as one of my references so she is nice!
Dr. Harper is a good professor. She is clear and she prepared students well for the exams. She is more than willing to help in office hours on engineering and physics.

Dr. Harper is my favorite teacher that I have had at OSU. She is very helpful and is always willing to help you if you try hard in class. Tests are pretty challenging, but that is FEH, not her as a teacher. Very enthusiastic and is easy to approach.

exams run by FEH department.  lectures are relatively short so plenty of time to complete most homework assignments in class.  lectures at times are boring and not helpful, but overall a fairly good teacher for 191
N/A

She is a very good teacher.  She doesn't always cover everything in class, but that's why she has office hours.  If you go to her office hours and her review sessions, you will do great.  I had her for 131i and 132i, I received a B- in 131 and an A+ in 132, the only differance was that I went to her office hours.  She doesn't spoonfeed you.

She's pretty clear for a physics professor but she gets mixed up with her example problems a lot which is kind of confusing.  And her exams are pretty hard - although I know that there are multiple professors who write the exams.

She is a great prof. I have learned tons from her and if you dont understand something she is always willing to help. In fact she even helped me out in 132 eventhough i didn't have her as a prof! She is awesome! Do anything to get her.
She teaches well, very clear.  Teaches application, not just concept.  Overall, very good professor.

Definately a tough teacher.  Lots of material is covered in this course.  Her lectures cover the basics, but most of the learning you have to do on your own by reading the text.  She is extremely helpful when you visit her during office hours.
never gave useful information in class, only covers the basics, while assigning impossible homework
She spends more time confusing us than she does clarifying.  Thanks to Harper, Ill get to use freshman forgiveness!

Assumes you know more than she teaches you, can be confusing at times, though she is very willing to help. As long as you have a decent TA, you should do alright.  She actually makes the tests used in honors physics, and often forgets to teach a certain type of problem that is on the test!  Voice is a little annoying also...

Good prof. GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS.  she does not usually have the time to teach everything in her lecture. She is much clearer one on one. She makes mistakes but that's becuase she does problems on the fly rather that having them prepared.  It gives insight into problem solving techniques. Nice lady.
She is the most clueless professor I have ever met. However, class can be somewhat amusing because it is obvious most students know more about physics than she does.
wow
goes over extremely easy problems in class and tests over very hard problems. not a teacher you want to have

I don't understand all these negative comments.  Dr. Harper obviously loves teaching and is extremely knowledgeable on this topic.  Electromagnetic physics a difficult topic yet Dr. Harper makes it easy.  Tests are not too difficult and everything is covered in class.

Dr. Harper was funny and made the class interesting (well as it can be). The tests weren't asking the impossible and she was helpful. The hw was hard, but I struggled in the class because I hate physics...
decent teacher, not great-seems to get confused in front of the class, gives incorrect information in lecture, tests very difficult for me, compared to getting 100% in Doty's 111 class

She is the worst professor you will ever have. She does not know what she is talking about, and things you have never seen before will appear on your tests. Take Doty, she knows what she is talking about.
Kathy Harper..where do i begin?? While she is a nice woman, she is the most confusing prof i have ever had...Tests are very tricky as well. DO NOT TAKE HER!! Don't say i didn't warn you...

Piss-poor teacher. She frequently continues lectures after the bell as rung, frantically trying to give us essential formulas as everyone filters out of the room. She can't explain anything and uses retarded analogies like "yelling at a birthday cake" Try and get another teacher if you can.
Bad Teacher.  Didn't learn anything.  Stoped going to class after first midterm and my grades went up.  No curve, try to get a different teacher.
This lady is nuts, leprachauns as electricity, its hard to understand as it is then you bring in kids stuff and it just confuses us more.  Worst prof I've ever had.
No Comments
She tries really hard, but sometimes her lectures are confusing.  I still managed to get an A though

Kathy Harper tried really hard to be helpful but I really got nothing out of her.  I'm not sure if the course itself was just extremely difficult or if it was her lack of teaching. In office hours and out of class she was helpful...sleep through lecture!
This professor as a lecturer was horrible.  She knows the subject material, but she has a hard time getting her point across.
what an awful teacher; thank goodness she's finally gone to that other dept

Thought Dr. Verma was a great lecturer (though the content could get a bit boring). The class was very well-organized. Only complaint is that she is HORRIBLE at responding back to emails. Emailed three times for three different occasions and never got a response back. Harsh grading for 1181 assignments and more work than expected for 2 credit hrs

She does not grade all your projects until the end of semester so you wont be able to know if you are doing well or not until then. Shes a very tough grader who consider everyone as a grad student. Even if you put lots of effort in this class you may still not get a very satisfying score. LOTS of homework to do compare to other profs ENGR 2367.

I love her personality,. But she does not grade her big assignments until the end of the semester, so no feedback until then. Since this was a summer 6 week course, materials were overloaded in one week. She even gives unnecessary assignments like posting and replying on discussion boards, and quizzes. Take other prof or don't take 6 week class.

Dr. Hall is a fine professor. My biggest issue was that your grade consists mostly of projects, yet she had almost none graded by the end of the semester. By the time we submitted our final project, only 30% of the total class points were in the grade book, so you had no idea if you were doing well on projects or what your final grade would be.

Professor Hall is really accessible outside of class and she gives great feedback when you're working on assignments. However, she put in 80% of the assignments on the day grades were due. Also, a lot of the readings were somewhat unnecessary. At any rate, she's still a solid professor and you'll learn a lot if you work hard. :)

Graded 80% of the assignments the day grades were due, so if you want feedback this is not the professor to choose. Since everything was graded in a day, grades for assignments were inflated due to the rush, which can be a good thing

She's a great lecturer and a smart lady. Unfortunately, she couldn't give us feedback on time, considering how busy she was with other things in her life. Imparted some valuable knowledge about writing, but a lot of the projects seemed like a drag. She's definitely a good choice if you want to take this class.
Highly engaging, informative, and funny lectures. Projects/assignments are incredibly helpful and include things such as making a resume and writing a cover letter. Phenomenal professor.

She is nice and adds humor to lecture but is an unnecessarily hard grader. She is also so slow at grading, like a month after each deadline. So I did not have any basis for grading until too late. Utilize office hours. Helpful if you want to learn to write, but not an easy class. Wish I took something else.

Class is pretty easy honestly, but don't put work off. The A is a 94, so a 93 is an A-. Missing a few points at the beginning and then messing up a group project could kill you.   Overall great class, very chill low stress. She's busy with other stuff so a slow grader but Lynn is awesome
I don't know what everyone else is saying, but she was an extremely difficult professor
This class is so useful for your future career.... If you have the chance you have to take it with her. Just do the work and you are 100% guaranteed an A.

Great Teacher. Learned a lot about writing, resume building, constructing persuasive papers and etc. Didn't really need to read the book because she repeats the info in class. There is a PDF of the book online so there is no to purchase if you do want to read. I actually liked writing by the end of the semester. Would recommend for anyone.

Grading is clear and every project has a very specific rubric. I think 60 to 70% of your grade is purely from group projects. All notes and handouts are on carmen. Attendance is mandatory, but you can miss 3 classes for free. Her extension on late projects is one whole week.   The class is actually pretty useful.
Great teacher and you learn a lot about professional writing. As long as you've shown effort on your projects and do your best to be awesome, it shouldn't be too hard to get a good grade.

Lynn is awesome.  I took the class over Maymester and everything is really abbreviated, so there's more work out of class but she gives a lot of in class time too.  Generally helpful.  Good class - take it for 2nd year writing.

She was a great instructor. The class is helpful if you haven't put together a resume, cover letter, or other technical documents before. If you have, then it's very easy and you can turn in what you've already done.

Took online, taught for about 20 min of my 2hr and 20min class that we weren't allowed to leave. She had TA's do half the teaching, who had no idea what they were doing. All my learning was done outside of her teaching with my ENED group. Do not reccomend.

Took online course due to covid. Bare minimum for maybe 20 minutes worth of lecture each class then passed on to TAs that clearly weren't told the plan for the day. Says absolutely no late submissions or excuses yet is late to class lectures due to "not starting her computer over the entire weekend". Doesn't actually teach anything needed for quiz

She is extremely to the point and covers the materials accurately. The powerpoint she uses is enough for understanding. You can finish homework in class if you want to. Graphics is rough as points are cut fr even missing a line but Solidworks should be fine enough. Be sure to take care about your homework as it constitutes tremendous part of grade
GREAT PROFESSOR!
Nicholas is a great professor! His lecture is awesome and tests are easy. You will get an expected grade once pay effort to his material.
Stupid teacher
Discriminating against students, abusing students

Changed the weighting last minute without telling anyone and refused to honor the bonus points that were listed on the syllabus. Absolutely insane. First day of class she told us she didnt like the subject lol. Tests made up 80% of the final grade if youre into that

She was a very helpful professor; one of the smartest I've had. The two projects do seem like a lot, but only introduced those to give exam less weighting. Projects give real live examples of the content too. Exams weren't terrible at all. Seemed to make them easier as the semester went on. She's blunt, but real with you when talking.

Professor Zhao clearly does not know how to talk to students. She was very rude during hours office and never appeared she wanted to be helpful. She would give difficult problems on exams. There were three midterms and two projects, which was a lot. If you end up taking this class, go to the TAs for help. They are so much more helpful.

Trust me when you read this, I havent seen such a rude teacher ever in my life. You ask her questions,go to her office hours,instead of answering something simply she would humiliate you,make you feel so uncomfortable. You might do good in her class but if you can, please save your time and get a different section. Youll regret taking her!!!!

Professor Zhao very clearly cared about how we did in her class, probably the most out of every professor I've had at OSU. Homeworks take a little time but are worth doing well, as they usually reflected what would be on the exams. Exams were hard but fair and she usually had them graded the day we took them. The class also had a nice curve.

I had professor Guenther for 654. He was engaging and challenging. He is a consummate engineer. Very intelligent but looks for the simplest solution. One of the best teachers if not the best I've ever had. Great person and truly cares that his students get a great education.
Great teacher and advisor. He can be intimidating at first, so dont sit in the front row or look directly into his eyes.

Denny is a cool dude, I would love to hang out with him. The pizza party is great. However, when it comes to teaching, I didn't find his methods very useful. Very fast pace, very difficult. Tests were more or less over finding stuff in the book you hadn't covered. Labs and homeworks help a lot! Oh yeah, only class I never slept in.

Great teacher!  Definitely got into the class and made it interesting.  If you see chalk on the walls and all off the board, that was probably him.  His tests are fair but can be difficult, but makes up for it with the homework and lab report grades.

Best prof i've had at OSU. He's a great guy who actually loves teaching and makes his class fun. He even took us out for pizza and beer at the end of the quarter. Take a class with him before he retires, "ARE WE CLEAR?!?!?!"

Crazy Denny was hands down the best prof at OSU ME. Just as smart as guys like Moran, but an engineer at heart that loves solving problems. Funny as hell if you worked for him a little bit after class. I have so many stories about all of the crash test stuff we did at Battelle.

Denny is a great teacher.  He can be tough at times, but he always tries to make sure you understand the material and is very accommodating.  A very good professor.  I would gladly take another one of his classes.  Was probably my best professor @ OSU.
Best Professor I have ever had.

MODUS OPERANDI! The best teacher in the world; does problems rather than teaching the stuff because he is an engineer, not a teacher... but that doesn't matter. If you want to have an entertaining class where you look forward to going at 830 in the morning then choose denny... epic

He comes off as strict and difficult, but he is extremely fair and will teach you a lot. He cares a lot about his students and is willing to help.  I would definitely recommend taking a class with him.

Fun class, awesome prof. It starts off slow but once the projects get going you'll be putting in a lot of work outside of class. It's interesting though, you're pretty much on your own to solve whatever open-ended project you get. I'd recommend him for 564.

Very entertaining class. He makes it as interesting as possible. Homeworks are as tough as one can ever get. But solutions are available anytime. Exams are unbelievably tough for a 654 class. But gradings are compensatorily easy for the effort we put in.

Wow! Probably the hardest class I've taken! Homeworks are long (although solutions are posted) and the midterm/final were extremely difficult (take home final = 16+ hours). Thank God that Denny is a really nice professor who makes class exciting. The class is an A/B class; if you put in the work and effort, you'll receive a decent grade.

Challenging content. Very broad course. Likewise, the tests are challenging, but Professor Lannutti grades generously. Professor Lannutti appears to have spent his career in industry. Spinodal decomposition is important for this course. Calculations about chain length get complicated. Differential scanning calorimetry problems were difficult.

Lannutti is extremely knowledgable about his field, and can answer pretty well any question you ask him. He's an excellent lecturer and does a good job presenting the material to you. His tests are very difficult, and push you beyond just basic understanding of the class content to being able to extrapolate and think beyond what he's told you.
Very smart guy
No Comments

Worst ever. Seems friendly on the outside but is extremely mean inside and grading wise. She'll find the littlest things like the other TAs to try to take points of your assignments only she never gives out any good grades even though the assignments match the rubric perfectly. Good luck if you get her!

She probably is the worst. Takes the most points off any assignment compared to everyone else even though the rubrics are so unclear on how to write our papers and she doesn't even know what is going on.
For 1182, she was awful. Never really knew what was going on in class and graded papers so harshly in the end. Always found a way to take even a single point off your papers.
Not nice and not very helpful, considering COVID has made things harder on students too.

Extremely tough grader. Very nitpicky so being slightly wrong is the exact same thing as completely bombing the problem. If you get something in wrong in part a, he'll take off points for carrying over the wrong answer in parts b and c. From what I've heard, his lecturing in class is okay but online its just reading overstuffed powerpoint slides.

Exams are impossibly hard. Spends most of class deriving equations, few example problems. Attending Recitation is a must. Homework is due weekly(15wks=15hwks) and due before you know how to do the actual problems. Read the book, material is hard enough without it.
Very hard, but useful and helpful.

This class was very challenging. Igor knows the material very well, but has difficulty simplifying the solving-process and tends to jump around from step-to-step. This makes it hard to keep up. His exams were painfully hard.
Not a bad prof.  test were tough.

Decent lecturer.  Will spend alot of time deriving equations but you are not expected to do it on the tests. Tests were fair but he will throws curve balls. Decently fair class overall.  Could have been better cold have been worse.

If you hhhhhhh-ave this professor, you will get to see him draw "cartoons" on the board. Not a bad lecturer, but goes very fast. Quizzes are mostly over manipulation of equations, tests are pretty difficult (i.e. homework problems, with a twist that make them harder). ME 510 is difficult, mainly because it should be at least a 4 credit hour class!
Just cuz

Dr. Soledad has a fair amount of experience in her past when it comes to engineering, so she knows a lot about group work and giving feedback for any assignment she gives you. I have never seen her frustrated, even when the whole class was online. She is very helpful and nice and if you put any effort into her classes, you are guaranteed to pass.
